She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao D., 31, is single and lives with her parents, brothers and sisters along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sreymao has been a farmer for over 20 years. She grows many kinds of vegetables and sells her products to a middleman. She doesn’t have enough money to support her vegetable farm so she is asking for her first loan of $450. She will use part of her loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: Growing vegetables and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Onn C., age 52, and his wife, Roeun Chheang, age 46, have been married since 1982. They have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Two of them are married and live away from the family home.  Three children are garment factory workers and the others are in school. Their family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Onn and his wife have been farming for 10 years. They grow many kinds of vegetable on their own farmland behind their house. The couple doesn’t have enough capital to sustain their farm. Onn requests his first loan of $500 for working capital.

loans.use: Capital for farm operation.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy C., 52 and her husband, Chanthy C., 51, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children: two daughters are married and live in separated homes and one son attends school. 

Chanthy and her husband have rented space in their house since 1990.  Their house is located near a garment factory.  The couple hopes to build more rooms to met their customer’s needs. 

Hence, Chanthy is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: Build more rooms for renting.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been selling poultry on a small scale to residents of Naivasha town. She is married to Elijah Njuguna and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by her friend and this will be her first loan.  With the loan, Elizabeth plans to buy more chickens, which will be ready to sell during the approaching festive season.

One day, she hopes to go into real estate and build a house for rentals on the piece of land she owns to diversify her income.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Fe Erma

texts.en:
At the age of 52 years old, Fe Erma A. is two years older than her husband Biato A.. Their three children: Emilio, 26, Ana Marie, 25, and Angelica, 21, are their blessings from above and the reasons they strive hard to fight against poverty. Now their grandchildren are added as their reason. All of their children now work after graduating from college but they don't oblige them to give them money because they know that their children have also their own families to support, and also because they have their own business that supports them in their living.

This business is a fishing business. They have a fish pond in the sea and her husband is the one who personally manages it because he is a fisherman. When the Typhoon Ondoy entered their area of the Philippines their fish pond was damaged because as the level of water in the sea got high all the fish inside the fish pond were lost. Now they want to expand the fish pond and put other small fish to raise until it is ready fpr harvest. She will use the loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) to buy what is needed for expanding the fish pond.

Fe Erma’s hopes that their business will continue to run and grow so that instead of their children helping them that they are the ones who will help them especially in the education of their grandchildren. She is praying to God to give her and her husband a long life so that they will guide their children in taking care of their own families.

loans.use: To rebuild and increase a fishing business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy A. is 23 years-old and is married to Tom Marera. They are proud parents to Winnie and Daniel. The family lives in the coastal town of Shanzu. For the last four years, Nancy has been in the business of poultry keeping. As a supplement to her income she also sells vegetables and cereals. Nancy is accessing her first loan from Kiva partner KADET and with it she plans to purchase chicks for rearing and cereals and vegetables to sell. When her chicks mature, she will sell them to hotels (cafes) in the beach town of Shanzu. One day, Nancy plans to diversify her businesses further by purchasing a plot of land and putting up rental houses.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase chicks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane K. is 49 years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in Shanzu, Mombasa, where she is a tailor. Jane has been in the business of tailoring for 11 years and her business is a success. She also owns rental houses which supplement the family income.

Jane is accessing her first KADET loan and with it she plans to purchase tailoring materials and to perform some refurbishments to her shop. Her main customers are local residents -- mainly parents of school children. One day, Jane hopes to expand her tailoring business and to also offer employment to others.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and to perform some refurbishments to her shop.

loans.name: Norah Kihunya

texts.en:
Norah is 31 years-old and married with two children. She sells cereals to her customers at Umoja estate in Nairobi. She has been running her business for a period of about three years and has been making a profit of approximately 5,000 Kenya shillings a month. 

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by her mother who is also member of a borrower group. Norah will use the loan to restock her shop with more cereals. She hopes to be a great supplier to other institutions one day.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam N., age 51 and his wife Chanthoeun Phan, age 50, were married in 1989 and have five children. The eldest son is a construction worker, three are in school and another is young. The family is living in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Lam and his wife has been selling mats for six years. They buy from the nearby district and sell at other province far from their house such as Takeo province, Kampong Speu province and so on. 

Lam hopes to expand his business so he can generate much income. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $300 to purchase more mats to resale.

loans.use: Purchase more mats for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 34 years-old, married to Phyllis Gathoniand and they have three school going children. Simon has run his barber shop for two years. He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. With it, Simon plans to buy a new battery charger, since he uses power from a battery to power the machines he uses.

One day, Simon hopes to open more barber shops around town to increase his level of income and improve his standard of living.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a battery charger.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 38 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a mobile photographer in the Kiambu district. Most of his customers are within the Kikuyu area. He has been in the business for about 10 years and gets a profit of about 20,000 Kenya shillings a month.

Fredrick is the founder of his group and wants to use this loan to buy a digital camera in order to meet the demand of his clients and upgrade to the current technology. He hopes to open a big photo studio in Nairobi town one day soon.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a digital camera for his photography business

loans.name: Eunice Kwamboka

texts.en:
Eunice Kwamboka is a 43-year-old mother of five. She is an industrious lady married to Daniel, a businessman. Eunice sells groceries on a wholesale basis in the open-air market. She has been in this business for 20 years, during which she has seen the business grow from a small retail stall to its current level.

Eunice learned about KADET Ltd., a Kiva partner, through a friend who is an existing client of KADET Ltd. She started with a small loan. Eunice's KADET loans have grown level by level and this will be her fourth and largest loan so far with KADET. With this loan, Eunice will increase her stock of supplies and start growing tomatoes in an attempt to improve the self-sufficiency of her business.  

She aspires to purchase land and see her last two children through school.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her wholesale business, including tomatoes

loans.name: Doem

texts.en:
Doem D., age 57 (picture with his wife) and his wife Norn Thuch, age 57, live in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have five sons and one daughter. Three of them are married and live outside the home, three attend school and another is a construction worker. 
 
Doem has been driving a motor taxi for 15 years.  Norn has sold fruits for 10 years. His motorbike is connected to a trailer at the rear. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh City and back.  Doem is applying for his first loan of $500 to add to his own savings to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle for his son to drive to work.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is 29 years old and single. He lives in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he operates a video showroom. He has been operating the business for three and a half years and mainly targets the youth and school children. He also performs acrobatics and dancing and hopes to make the art thrive both locally and abroad.

Mohamed is borrowing his first loan from KADET, a Kiva partner, and with it plans to purchase better furniture and a power meter and to complete some electronics repairs.

In the future, he intends to acquire a bigger screen and to expand the business premises to accommodate more customers. 

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase furniture and a power meter and to conduct electronics repairs for his video (movie) showroom

loans.name: Mohamad Chaaban

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a tailoring factory since 2007 and has 13 years of experience in this field. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additionA. merchandise to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah W. is 38 years old.  She is a single business lady who lives in Shanzu, Mombasa, where she operates a general merchandise store. She has been in the business for two years. Veronicah has diversified her source of income and also sells second-hand clothes and potatoes.  In the future Veronicah hopes to expand her business into a major supplies store and to also become a major horticulturalist supplier. 

This will be her Veronicah's first loan from KADET and with the money she will purchase general merchandise for her shop, clothes for resale, and potatoes to sell. Her main customers are the residents of Shanzu.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise shop, clothes for resale and to also purchase potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita C. is 49 years old and is married to Alfredo C., a responsible guy who is 51 years old. Their two children are Ma. Theresa, 25 years old, and Alfredo Jr., 15 years old. Their daughter only attained a secondary level of education and they don’t want that to happen to their second child. He is now in high school and they want him to finish college. This is one of their motivations in life for which they continue to strive hard. 

Alfredo is a fisherman who had a fish cage placed in the sea. During Typhoon Ondoy (Sept. 30, 2009), however, the fish cage was slightly damaged and the high level of water caused the fish inside the cage to be lost.

The loan that Lolita will receive through Kiva's field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) will be used to purchase cage materials, repair the damaged fish cage, and buy small fish to be placed in the cage until they are ready for harvest. Lolita is hoping that this business will give them more income so that she can afford to send her son to college. 

Lolita has many plans for the improvement of their lives, so she is praying to God to give her more life and a healthy mind and body so that she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: To repair a damaged fish cage

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man working as a policeman in the Palestinian National Authority. He takes home a monthly salary of 470 USD. He currently lives with his family: his father, who is a daily paid worker, his mother and his brother. Jamal appears in the photo at the FATEN office in Tulkarem.

Mahmoud applied to FATEN to receive a loan of 2,000 USD in order to buy his brother a computer as his brother is studying in the university. Part of the loan will also be used to obtain a license to start building his own house since he plans to get married in a couple of years.

loans.use: To buy his brother a computer and to get a licence to build a new house

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. is 37 years old and married to Nancy Njoki. They have 3 school-going children. For the last 5 years Patrick has used his bicycle to transport clients from one place to another around Naivasha town.

Now Patrick wants to upgrade to a motorcycle. He will use his loan to buy a new motorcycle.

Patrick was introduced to KADET by his friend. This is his first loan with KADET. In the future he plans to expand into the transport business and buy a lorry. He will use this lorry to transport goods to and from the market.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his taxi business (upgrade from bicycle).

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a 38 year-old woman who lives in Tangal with her husband and one son and one daughter. Both her children are now studying.

Mrs. B. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. She makes school uniforms for boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta salwar, blouses, ladies’ long dresses, and other such clothes. Before starting her own business she trained In tailoring for six months.

Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of 30000 NPR to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Mrs. Nora L. is from the village of Tugas, Baliangao Misamis, Occidental. She is 51 years old, married and blessed with 3 children.

She has been engaged in her business for more than 7 years. She earns 8500 PHP monthly from her business.

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to access their programs and services. Currently she's requesting her 5th loan, for 50000 PHP, that she will use as additional capital for her hog-raising business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog-raising business.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 34 year-old single man who lives with his parents and 3 brothers. He works hard to provide his parents with better living conditions and to support their needs.

Nabil has worked as an internet distributor in his town since 2006. 

Nabil requests a loan to buy additional and newer equipment for his clients. 

He hopes to attract more customers and become well known in his village as a good businessman.

loans.use: To buy additional, newer equipment.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a young man who owns a small shop in Tulkarem city. He sells all kinds of women’s accessories including necklaces, bracelets, earrings, in addition to makeup, hair-treatment products, scarves, and many other things.

Jamal established this business 3 years ago and now he plans to take a loan from FATEN of 1,000 USD in order to redecorate his shop and to increase the space for showing his products.

Jamal is not married and he lives with his family. He doesn't contribute to the overall family income since his father asked him to use all his profits to improve his business.

Jamal appear in the photo at his place of business.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop and increase its space

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir G. has been in the house repairing business for 4 years. He was born in 1976. Zakir is married, but does not have children. He lives in Fuzuli region. 

Zakir requests a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his house repairing business.

loans.use: To improve his business.

loans.name: Hnadi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hnadi, 38, lives in Nablus city of Palestine, where she has a beauty salon business. She attends to it everyday, offering stylist and cosmetology services to her customers.

Hnadi is asking for a loan of $2500 so she can purchase more cosmetics and hair products to meet the demands of her customers. Among her goals are letting her four children continue their studies so they can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Ratna Shova B. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Ratna Shova B. lives in a single family with her husband and three children.

Both Mrs. and Mr. B. are engaged in tailoring work. Tailoring is their traditional work and they learned tailoring from their forefathers. They make different types of clothes for both ladies and men. Especially they make pants and shirts for gents and blouses and traditional kurta sulwar and makhshi for ladies.

Now Mrs.B. is requesting for Rs 30000.00 loan to buy raw materials for tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
A married father of four, Mr. Zaher was born in 1979 in Palestine. His wife is a housewife, so he alone is responsible for the family expenses.

Zaher has a small restaurant and he would like a loan of $3000 to invest in tables, chairs and utensils. With this money he will be able to expand his business, earn more profit and in turn help his children complete their school studies and continue studying at the university.

Contribute to the growth of his business and he will be grateful.

loans.use: Invest in tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Francis Ndungu

texts.en:
Francis Ndung’u is 33 years old and married with two children. He rears chickens and keeps dairy cows. He has been in this business for a period of about nine years and has been earning a profit of approximately 25,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

He is one of the founders of his borrowers group. Francis wants to use this loan to buy more chickens and an extra dairy cow in order to increase his productivity and profits. He has never borrowed from another MFI. He hopes to have over a thousand chickens and more than ten cows in the future.

About KADET 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase chickens (those that lay eggs) and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucy Wanja

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother, 40 years old, blessed with two daughters, Margaret and Mary. She was introduced to Kiva partner Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She is applying for her first loan with Kadet.

Lucy has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past three years. She also knits sweaters, which is her other source of income.

Lucy is going to use this loan to increase her stock of charcoal and knitting thread for sweaters. With the extra profits, Lucy hopes to purchase a motorcycle to use as a means of transport for her charcoal. Her dream is to expand her business and to stock highly demanded fuel sources such as  firewood and timber as well as charcoal.

Lucy has been able to single-handedly educate her daughters through the proceeds from her business. She describes herself as a trustworthy lady, faithful and a very hardworking business person.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To puchase charcoal stock and knitting thread for sweaters.

loans.name: Jamilla Bisher

texts.en:
Jamilla Bisher is fifty-one years old and has two children (aged 22 and 12). She operates a small boutique in which she stocks mainly ladies' and children's wear, being the most profitable segment of the market, according to her. She has been in this business for six years, four of which she dealt in very small stock due to a lack of capital.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a neighbour and friend, who noticed her business potential. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd and she will use it to stock more clothing and diversify into beauty products in preparation for the fast approaching festive season. She also intends to include some jewelery in her stock, to enable her to serve her customers' needs effectively.

Jamilla aspires to purchase a plot of land in the urban neighbourhood, develop it, and ultimately open a wholesale boutique with support from KADET Ltd.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock and diversify into beauty products.

loans.name: Taroob

texts.en:
Taroob is a women who started her business ten years ago. She started with only 3 sheep and when she received a loan from FATEN amounting to 3000 USD, she used the loan to buy more goats/sheep. Now she has more than 20 sheep and goats, and she has established a small mini-market. She has already repaid this loan in full, and now she needs 2000 USD to buy more goats and to acquire more products for her shop.

Taroob is married, her husband is a teacher in a public school; she has four children, three of them still at school while the fourth is at the university. Her husband and eldest child help her manage the two businesses. She is very happy to have established a business of her own and to help her family to have better life.

Taroob appears in the picture in her barn.

loans.use: Buy goats and sheep and develop her mini-market

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu was born in 1972. She lives in Fuzuli region. She is married and has 2 children. 6 years ago, she started an orchard business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Simon Musyoka

texts.en:
Simon is a 32-year-old single man. His primary business is photography. He also has a grocery shop in Kayole where most of his clients are. He has been in the business for a period of four years and has been getting a profit of approximately 12,000 Kenya shillings a month.

He was introduced to KADET by a member of his borrower group. He has never borrowed from another MFI and this is his first loan with KADET. With it, he plans to buy a stock of groceries for his shop in order to increase his profit and improve his living standards. He hopes to expand his business by opening new outlets in different areas. 

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries for his secondary business

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana D. is a 45-year-old mother of four children namely: Romero, 23 years old, Mary Rose, 21 years old, Miraflor, 20 years old, and Merdan, 10 years old. Her husband is Danilo D., who is now 51 years old; he is the one who manages one of their businesses which is making painted signs. This is one of the sources of their income; aside from that is their sewing business that Marciana personally manages because she knows how to sew a clothes. She manages the business well. Most of their children are currently studying thus more expenses for the parents; they need to double their work to make their business more productive.

When Marciana joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she properly utilized every loan that she received. She will be using her 6th loan to buy necessary things for her sewing business and also for the business managed by her husband. She will buy cloth, thread, and some paint. She is sure that when she buys this, it will help their business to be more productive and that will give them enough income for all of their expenses.

Marciana's dream is to have her own dress shop and to have a big income and also to help some in her neighborhood who know how to sew clothes by employing them in her hoped-for dress shop. And through the success of her business, she hopes she can afford to send their children to school through college.

loans.use: To finance her sewing business and their second business

loans.name: Elizabeth Mugoiri

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been  a dairy farmer for a period of about seven years now. She has been getting a profit of  approximately 20000 Kenya shillings a month. 

She is one of the founders of her borrower group. She wants to use the loan to buy an extra cow to increase milk production in order to meet her customers' needs.  One day, she hopes to have over ten dairy cows to increase milk production and also to start rearing chickens

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to meet customer demand for milk

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiku

texts.en:
Lucy is a married lady, 34 years old, with two children (Douglas, age 8, and Caleb, age 3 1/2). She was introduced to Kiva Partner KADET through an existing client. She is applying for her 1st loan with KADET. With it, she plans to increase her stock of baby clothes, pullovers, shirts and napkins to sell in her shop. With the extra profit she hopes to earn, Lucy wants to purchase a sewing machine (to make cardigans)  and a computer.

Her dream is to open a wholesale shop selling clothes. Lucy is determined to grow her business; she is challenged by the fact that her clients prefer competitors with a greater selection. She believes that if her shop is well-stocked, she can attract more buyers who will like a wider variety of items to select from. She describes herself as hard-working.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase her stock of baby clothes

loans.name: Rodgers Amunga

texts.en:
Rodgers Amunga is married to Mary, a business lady, and they have three children. Rodgers is aged thirty-five and has been operating a laundromat for the last 10 years. He is able to support his family with the income from this business.

Rodgers learned about KADET Ltd through a friend who is an existing KADET Ltd client. This is Rodgers' second loan from KADET Ltd, and he intends to use the money to purchase modern ironing boards to replace the ones he is using and also employ someone to assist him in laundry duties. He also intends to start selling clothes to diversify his income sources.

He aspires to purchase land in the neighbourhood and give his children access to quality education.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase modern ironing boards and to employ an assistant

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa is married and she has three sons aged 33, 30, and 24 . The younger two work as daily-paid workers in Israel; the eldest is responsible for helping his mother in managing the farm and their new shop. The fourth is a girl aged 19, studying at the university. Her husband is working in the USA.

For 5 years, Arwa and her eldest boy, Hamza, have had a chicken farm where they raise chickens to sell wholesale. Now they want to take out a loan from FATEN amounting to 2000 USD to rent and decorate a new shop, in addition to buying some equipment so they can sell their chickens directly to customers with more profit.

Arwa appears in the picture at the FATEN office in Ramallah.

loans.use: Rent and decorate a shop to sell the chickens they raise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and 5 siblings. He has owned a car mechanic shop since 2007 and has 6 years of experience in this field. He wants to borrow US$ 800 to buy new tools instead of his used ones to be able to continue his work properly.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es: Cleotilde F. M. de 40 años de edad, originaria del departamento de Sonsonate, vive con sus tres hijos de 20,18 y 16 años de edad quienes estudian y ayudan en el negocio. Cleotilde se dedica a su negocio, una venta de pupusas y comida, el cual inicio hace catorce años con la idea de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, lo que no sabía Cleotilde era, que luego se enfrentaría sola a mantener su casa, ya que su esposo se ha separado de ella y ahora por medio del negocio Cleotilde sigue adelante. Cleotilde siente fuerzas para seguir luchando por su negocio el cual es su única fuente de ingresos y es por eso que a través de este crédito invertirá en materia prima para aumentar la producción del mismo.
texts.en:
Cleotilde F. M. is 40 years old and a native of the department of Sonsonate. She lives with her three children (ages 20, 18, and 16) who are studying and help with her business.

Cleotilde sells pupusas and other foods. She started her business 14 years ago with the idea of helping her husband with the household expenses. However, she never thought she would have to take full charge of her home since she is now separated from her husband. Cleotilde continues to manage her business in order to stay ahead. She feels strong enough to continue fighting for her business since this is her only source of income. This loan will be used to buy ingredients so that she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria R. una feliz ama de casa y madre tres hijos quienes viven con ella junto a su esposo en su hogar que se encuentra ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Ana ha instalado una venta de frutas y verduras a las afueras de su casa a pesar de tener un puesto fijo, Ana se apoya de su hijo mayor quien le ayuda en el negocio para que Ana se pueda ir caminando a otras colonias cercanas ofreciendo de sus productos de manera ambulante. El crédito que Ana esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras necesarias a su hogar, el cual ha sufrido de deterioros por el transcurso de los años.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria is a happy housewife and mother of three children. She and her husband have a home in the department of Sonsonate. Ana sells fruits and vegetables from a vending post established just outside of her home. Her oldest son helps run the business while she travels to other neighborhoods offering her products as a street vendor. Ana is requesting a loan to make improvements to her home, which has suffered damage over the years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old married man. He has been working selling charcoal since 2006 to earn income to satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Hussein is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy more merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is 23 years old and single. Misbah owns a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as meat, flour, pasta, rice, fruit, vegetables, oil, canned food, dairy products, bakery products, and beverages. Nowadays, his micro-enterprise generates a good income with which he can support himself.

Misbah is requesting a loan of US$ 3000 to increase his merchandise inventory to satisfy the demand of his customers and offer them better service and a greater variety of products. He appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: Increase his merchandise stock

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela M. S. reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán municipio del departamento de La Libertad es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo Ricardo quien es ya todo un hombre de 32 años de edad. A pesar de que María tiene 61 años de edad sus deseos de superación siguen latentes, ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que atiende su propio negocio que consta de la elaboración de comida, la cual luego es comercializada todos los días en los desayunos y almuerzos, el deseo de María es seguir ampliando su negocio, deseo que solo puede ser posible con la ayuda de este crédito, que le permitirá a esta mujer emprendedora comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para aumentar la producción de sus platillos.
texts.en:
María Ángela M. S. lives in the town of Antiguo Cuscatlán, which is in the department of La Libertad. She is a single mother who lives with her only son Ricardo, who is 32 years old. Even though she is 61 years old, María still has the desire to succeed. She is a responsible and hardworking woman who manages her own food business, in which she prepares and sells breakfasts and lunches on a daily basis. Her hope is to continue expanding her business, which can only be possible with the help of this loan. As a result, this businesswoman will be able to buy supplies in large quantities so that she can produce more dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to construct a bar at the nearby market. Charity is 36 years old and is single with no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by opening a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to build a bar

loans.name: Kenia Beatriz

texts.es: Kenia Beatriz M. V. reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Kenia tiene 25 años de edad, se encuentra soltera y vive junto a su hermana. Kenia es una mujer con grandes deseos de superación, ella ha instalado su propio negocio con muchos esfuerzos y ahorros,su negocio consta de una venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, surtida con productos de excelente calidad y precios muy accesibles, ahora ella solita de un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en el crecimiento de su negocio, anteriormente ya ha manejado otros créditos y ha sido puntual en sus cuotas asignadas.
texts.en:
Kenia Beatriz M. V. lives in the department of San Salvador. She is 25 years old, single, and lives with her sister. Kenia has a tremendous desire to succeed. With hard work and the use of her savings, she started her own business selling men’s and women’s clothing. Her products are of excellent quality and the prices are affordable.

Kenia is now requesting a loan to increase her inventory, which will allow her to continue growing her business. She was able to manage her previous loans and make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Poni is 20 years old and married to a driver. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel V. F. reside en el departamento de La Libertad con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad ambos estudiantes. Maribel se ha ingeniado mucho para emprender su negocio, ella posee una receta familiar de exquisitas quesadillas las cuales realiza de manera artesanal en un horno rustico, son dieciséis años de experiencia los que Maribel ha dedicado a su negocio  y por ello que su negocio es muy conocido en la zona, el deseo de Maribel quien solicita de este crédito es para compra mayor cantidad de materia prima y nuevas mesas en las cuales ella pone su productos para vender.
texts.en:
Maribel V. F. lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband and two children, who are students ages 17 and 11. She managed to establish a business around a family recipe for quesadillas*, which she produces by hand using a rustic oven. Maribel has been dedicated to her business for 16 years and has become well known in the area. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in bulk as well as tables on which she can prepare her products for sale. (*Unlike the Mexican snack of the same name, the Salvadoran quesadilla is a rich, sweet dessert cake often found in local bakeries. The "queso" in quesadilla is traditionally unsalted Salvadoran queso fresco, a fresh farmers-type cheese.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk & tables for her workspace

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha M. D. G. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo don Juan D. 60 años D. edad. Hace quince años Bertha tiene una tienda D. comestibles y otros artículos para el hogar, el negocio D. Bertha le ha permitido sostener los gastos del hogar, gracias a la demanda que posee por ser una tienda muy reconocida en la zona , para Bertha su negocio sigue teniendo las posibilidad D. crecer es por ello que en esta oportunidad ella solicita D. un crédito que le la oportunidad D. surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha M. D. G. resides in the Ahuachapan region with her husband Juan, who is 60 years old. For 15 years Bertha has had a store selling food and other household items. Bertha's business has allowed her to proviD. for the household expenses, thanks to strong demand at the store, which is very well known in the area. Bertha believes that her business continues to have growth possibilities, and for this reason she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to stock up her store with merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her business

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en: Kaku M. is currently in the business of buying and selling fish and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her dried fish. Kaku is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander T. is married with one child. He sells plumbing equipment at a hardware market in Berdyansk town. Alexander has been in this business for 8 years.

Alexander is a very talented entrepreneur. He attracts clients with good quality products and affordable prices. Many clients come back which helps Alexander to develop his business further. 

Alexander would like to borrow 15000 UAH to increase his working capital. 

With the loan he plans to purchase more inventory and increase his sales. His business goal is to start a second location.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Sasu

texts.en:
Sasu V. is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. 

Sasu is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and beans to sell. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: María Otilia

texts.es:
María Otilia G. H. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, es madre soltera, vive solo con su hijo José de 17 años de edad.
Para María no ha sido una tarea fácil llevar consigo las responsabilidades del hogar y la educación de su hijo, hace diez años ella comenzo su propio negocio una tienda de productos de consumo para el hogar , ella instalo su negocio en su casa de esta manera ella cuidaría de su hijo y administraría su negocio y es así como creció en pequeño José que ahora ya es todo un adolecente responsable y muy colaborador con su madre que solo cuenta con él. El crédito ella solita es para invertir en su negocio con la compra de productos para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Otilia lives in the Ahuachapán region. She is a single mother who lives alone with her 17 year old son, José. It has not been an easy task for María to carry the responsibilities of caring for her home and educating her son. Ten years ago, she started her own business, a store selling consumer products for the home. She started the business in her own home so that she could care for her son and manage her business. This is how José was raised, and today he is a responsible teenager and partner for his mother, who only has him to rely on. María will use this loan to invest in her business by buying inventory to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for her business

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a young single man; he lives with his family in Nablus City. His father is a plumber.

Two years ago, Asem opened his shop selling mobile phones, accessories, and phone cards.  Asem has requested 3000 USD from FATEN to buy some stock for his shop. 

Asem appears in the picture at his shop.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones for the shop

loans.name: Oved Avisai

texts.es: Oved Avisai A. A. de 35 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 10, 6 y 2 años de edad. Oved  cruzo hasta el nivel educativo de básica, pero posee un talento nato en la confección, oficio el cual le ha permitido sostener a su familia, el hace todo tipo de ropa a la medida, también diseña variedad de estilos de cortinas y accesorios textiles para el hogar, el crédito que solicita Oved es para ampliar la producción de sus cortinas, juegos de cama, ropa,  y para ello tendrá que comprar mayor cantidad de tela.
texts.en:
Oved Avisai A. A. is 35 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with his wife and three children (ages 10, 6, and 2). Despite having a basic level education, he possesses a natural talent for sewing. This skill has enabled him to support his family. Oved produces all types of clothing. In addition, he creates a wide variety of curtains and home accessories.

Oved will use his loan to buy fabric in bulk so that he can increase his production of curtains, bedding, and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia R. is divorced with one adult son. She sells animal food at one of the markets in Melitopol town.

Natalia has been in this business for 14 years. She knows her products well and gives her customers quality advice as to choosing the best food for their pets. Moreover, Natalia's kiosk is located in the center of the market that attracts many new clients her way.

Natalia would like to borrow 7000 UAH to increase her assortment of goods.

She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods for sale.

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok M. is 26 years old and is widowed. She has 2 children and her children go to school.

Ajok is in the business of selling beer at the bar. She requests a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. 

With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 46-year-old man, married, with 10 children. He works hard as a farmer to provide better living conditions for his big family. He has been in agriculture for more than 30 years.

Today, Ahmad is applying for a loan of $1000 to purchase seedlings to cultivate more agriculture products in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Juan Moisés

texts.es: Juan Moisés O. C. reside en el departamento de San Salvador. A sus 40 años de edad Juan es padre soltero de cuatro niños de 15,12, 7 y 5 años de edad. Juan ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con mucha organización y sacrificios en su día a día, para generar ingresos para su familia, Juan se dedica a la confección de ropa la que luego es comercializada de manera ambulante por él, ahora Juan solita de un crédito para mejorar sus ingresos al igual que su calidad de vida a través del mejoramiento de ganancias por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juan Moisés O. C. lives in the department of San Salvador. He is a 40 year old single father of four children (ages 15, 12, 7, and 5). Juan has managed get ahead for the sake of children by being organized and making daily sacrifices. In order to generate an income for his family, Juan produces clothing and then sells them as a street vendor. He is now requesting a loan so that he can increase his sales, thereby improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel G. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bread, beans, beef, rice, etc. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bookshop. Daniel is 36 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Francisca Eugenia

texts.es: Francisca Eugenia M. E. reside en  el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad, vive con su familia que la compone su esposo y sus tres hijos de 21, 19 y 11 años de edad. Francisca tiene tan solo un año de haber iniciado su negocio tras la necesidad de asumir gastos en su hogar para ayudar  a su esposo, ella ha montado una pupuseria en la puerta de su casa, posee la ventaja de no tener competencia en la zona, es por ello que ha tenido una gran demanda y una clientela ya estable, razón por la cual Francisca tiene la fuerza para seguir creciendo en su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Francisca Eugenia M. E. lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children (ages 21, 19, and 11). A year ago, Francisca started her business because she needed to help her husband with the household expenses. She established a pupuseria on her front doorstep. Having no other competitors in her area, Francisca’s products are in high demand and attract a stable clientele. She has the strength to continue growing her business, so she needs to buy ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en: Yehia is 49 years old, married and the father of four children. He and his family live in Nablus, Palestine. Yehia owns a store where he sells fertilizer and other items that help farmers improve the size of their harvest. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy items to sell to his customers. He is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other items to sell to farmers

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is 41 years old, married man and has one child. He has been in the transportation business for the last 10 years, and was able to buy his own van in 2008. Now he is applying for a loan for $1,000 to perform maintenance on this van before winter weather arrives.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his van

loans.name: José Agustín

texts.es: José Agustín M. L. habitante del municipio de colon en el departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 12 y 2 años de edad. José curso hasta el nivel básico en la escuela, pero se ha especializado por medio de talleres y cursos en mecánica, y su mayor experiencia la tomo en la práctica cuando trabajaba como empelado en un taller automotriz, ahora José es propietario de un taller el cual su única fuente de ingresos, el solicita de un crédito para comprar materiales para su taller y así poder dar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Agustín M. L. lives with his wife and two daughers, who are 12 and 2 years old, in the Colon municipality, La Libertad department. José only finished elementary school but has taken courses and workshops in auto mechanics and gained the most experience when he worked as an employee at an auto shop. Now, José owns his own shop which is his sole source of income. He is requesting funds to buy supplies for his shop so that he can offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for his auto shop.

loans.name: Marta Gladys

texts.es: Marta Gladys C. M. reside en el departamento de La Libertad, Marta tiene 51 años de edad vive son su esposo, su hijo y su madre. Hace seis años Marta se dedica a su propio negocio, en cual recibe toda la ayuda y apoyo de su esposo, Marta elabora diariamente variedad de antojitos típicos para ser comercializados con su clientes, posee una gran demanda en sus productos, por sus deliciosos antojitos que ofrece, ella solicita de un crédito con el cual pueda incrementar la producción de sus antojitos y si mejoran sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta Gladys C. M. is 51 years old and lives with her husband, her son, and her mother in the La Libertad department. For the last 6 years Marta has had her own food preparation business for which she enjoys her husband's full support and help. Marta daily makes a variety of typical dishes which she sells to her customers. Her products are in high demand because her snacks are so delicious. She is requesting funds to buy raw materials so that she can produce more items thereby improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan O. makes a living running a small store, and is applying for this loan to buy items such as tooth brushes, toothpaste and soap to sell to her customers. She is 29 years old and married. Her husband makes a living as a clerk. They have five children, all of whom are in school. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy tooth brushes, toothpaste, soap and other items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 52 years old, single and has owned a local car-repair shop since 1975. He is well known in nearby villages because of his experience in this field. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy new tools. This will allow him to do a better job of serving his customers.

loans.use: to buy new tools for a car repair shop

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy J. makes a living selling charcoal, and is applying for this loan so that she can also begin selling dried cassava and sugar. She is 19 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is not yet old enough to go to school. With the extra profits generated by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her young family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy dried cassava and sugar to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 38-year-old widow with six children aged between 10 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Alice doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medication.

Alice has a stall in Kyebando-Nsooba in the outskirts of Kampala where she sells all kinds of foodstuffs and vegetables. She buys her foodstuffs from Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala, and pays for transport costs to and from shopping. On average she receives about twenty customers a day.

Alice has been in this business for five years and with MCDT one year. She is servicing her third loan, working with the same group members. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from coming to her stall because she works in a muddy place.

Alice wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of vegetables and bananas. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza T. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and onions to sell. Tereza is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant . She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase beans and onions to sell

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Mrs. Ahlam, aged 49, is the mother of four children. Her children are all already independent. Ahlam sells provisions in her grocery store. She now has a well-established clientele because of the personalized attention and the good variety of products she offers her customers.

Mrs. Ahlam is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as sweet bread, beverages in general, rice, pasta, vegetables, fruit, etc. Please help her by financing this loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita B. O. reside en El departamento de Sonsonate, con 62 años de edad, Ana es una mujer soltera, se dedica de completo a su negocio el cual tiene ubicado en su casa, es una tienda con productos de consumo para el hogar, también maneja una pequeña producción de pupusas y tortillas,  las cuales son consumidas por los clientes de la zona, que reconocen que la amabilidad de Ana es una gran cualidad en ella, el deseo de superación de Ana hace que ahora solicite de un  crédito para surtir su negocio con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para la tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita B. O. is 62 years old, single, and totally dedicated to running her grocery store which she operates from her own home. She lives in the Sonsonate department and also runs a small pupusa (maize dumpling) and tortilla production operation. Her customers are people from her area who are drawn by Ana's kindness, which is one of her characteristics. And is requesting funds to buy supplies so that she can have a more varied inventory in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 40-year-old widow with four children, aged between 10 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Alice doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a stall selling charcoal in Kabowa Suuna zone and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping because she buys from her place of work. She buys her charcoal from suppliers who get it from the villages.

Alice works seven days a week. On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She works on the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business fifteen years and with MCDT five years, servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medications. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her stall because she works in a muddy place.

Alice wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and to start buying directly from producers.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana Gladys A. G.  residente del departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposo quien es comerciante y su hijo de 18 años de edad estudiante. Hace nueve años Ana se inicio en su negocio vendiendo productos por catalogo de manera ambulante, con el transcurso del tiempo y las ganancias producidas por su negocio, Ana logro comprar mercadería para después ser revendida a sus clientes , es así como hoy tiene un pequeño inventario de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, el deseo de Ana es seguir invirtiendo en negocio, comprando productos que poseen  gran  demanda como los perfumes y otros artículos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Ana Gladys A. G., a resident of the department of La Libertad, lives with her husband, a merchant, and with her 18 year old son, a student. Nine years ago, Ana began selling products through a catalog on an itinerant basis. With the passage of time and the profits produced by her business Ana succeeded in buying merchandise for resale to her customers. Similarly, today she has a small inventory of products on offer to her customers. Ana’s wish is to continue investing in the business, buying products that are in great demand such as perfumes and other articles for personal use.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her inventory

loans.name: Maritza Arely

texts.es: Maritza Arely D. reside en el occidente del país en el departamento de Morazán. Con 47 años de edad Maritza es madre soltera de sus dos hijo de 22 y 21 años de edad.  Maritza ha sacado adelante a sus hijos por medio de las ganancias generadas por su negocio. Desde hace muchos años Maritza se dedica a la producción de comida, tras ver la necesidad de este tipo de negocio en su zona, fue  así como se animo emprender su comedor, de comida a la vista, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para aumentar la producción de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Maritza Arely D. lives in the western part of El Salvador in the department of Morazán. She is a 47-year-old single mother of two children, ages 22 and 21. Maritza has made headway with her children thanks to the profits she makes from her business. For many years she has made a living making food. After seeing a need for this type of business in her area, she was encouraged to start a diner, and now she is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to be able to make more meals

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida G. is now 57 years old and happily married to Ernesto G.. They were blessed with three children namely: Herardo 34 years old, Valentina 33 years old and Ernesto 17 years old. All of her children have their own work, which is one of the things she will be saying thanks to the Lord for, for giving all their children the chance of experiencing what life really is. But she and her husband still continue to strive so that they will not be a burden to their children, instead they will help each other in order for them to experience a better life.

Leonida runs a variety store business that is one of the sources of their income but aside from that, she also sells different homemade sandwich spreads like peanut butter and coco jam (made from coconut). Now she focuses on this business, and that is where she will use the loan that she will receive from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), buying things that are needed for this business. She will also use the loan in her trading business. This is the selling of different kinds of fish, some of the people in their place call this trading. She is hoping that after buying what is needed for her business, it will give them income for all of their expenses.

Leonida’s dream is to have a comfortable and strong house for their family. And she is also really hoping that her businesses will continue to run and grow so that her dreams will become possible.

loans.use: To finance her businesses

loans.name: Bilda Marisol

texts.es: Bilda Marisol M. D. G. resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango del departamento D. San Salvador. Bilda D. 46 años D. edad posee una extensa familia que esta compuesta por sus cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad y su esposo quien es empleado. Para Bilda manejar su propio negocio el cual es muy gratificante ya que manifiesta sentirse orgullosa y útil D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, hace doce años Bilda instalo una librería en su casa, la cual ahora quiere surtir con mayor variedad D. productos a través D. su ayuda otorgándole este crédito.
texts.en:
Bilda Marisol M. D. G. lives in the town of Ilopango, department of San Salvador. She is 46 years old and has a large family consisting of her four children, all minors, and her husband, who is employed. Managing her own business is what is most gratifying for Bilda because it makes her feel proud and helps her support her husband with household expenses. Twelve years ago Bilda set up a bookshop in her home, and she now wants to stock it with a wider variety of products through your help in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her bookshop

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en:
Saudah, 40, is married with seven children ages six months to 21 years.  Six children go to school. She resides in and owns a six room house where she stays with ten people.  Her family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.  Saudah takes care of additional family members.  

Saudah fries samosas chapati and kebab.  She uses public transport while distributing her food, selling retail and wholesale.  She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala and has been in business for seventeen years.  

Involved with MCDT for eight years, she is servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medication.  Saudah aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start buying directly from manufactures.

loans.use: Buy cooking supplies.

loans.name: Ige

texts.en: Ige is 35 years old and married with two children.  She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria and sells groundnut oil and foodstuffs.  Ige has been in business for the past 12 years. She requests a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groundnut oil and foodstuffs to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more groundnut oil and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: G. Agathe est née le 20 Janvier 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GNANSOUNOU François, Agathe est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Agathe vit dans le quartier Adogléta à Cotonou depuis deux ans avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Agathe a arrêté l'école au cours primaire et a appris la couture. Agathe confectionne en effet des tenues pour dames et les vend dans sa boutique à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou. Agathe s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter sa production et aussi la taille de sa clientèle, Agathe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Agathe ambitionne agrandir plus tard son lieu d'activité.
texts.en:
G. Agathe was born on January 20, 1982 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to GNANSOUNOU François, Agathe is the mother of 3 children, all enrolled in school. Agathe has been living in the Adogléta neighborhood in Cotonou for two years with her children and her husband. The couple share in supporting the family.

Agathe left school after the primary level and learned sewing. She sews outfits for women and sells them in her shop in Agbodjèdo in Cotonou. Agathe does her buying in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. In order to produce more and to grow her clientele, she is requesting a loan from ALIDé. Agathe's ambition is to be able to expand her shop later on.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sewing notions and lengths of cloth

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells fish and has been in this business for over 12 years. She is married with three children and is 40 years old. Dorcas would like a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more fish to sell. Dorcas says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rufine

texts.fr: La cliente est née le 19 Juillet 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une veuve qui a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Elle vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte les dépenses de la famille. Afin de subvenir au besoin de ses enfants, elle exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits (amuse-gueule, biscuits, bombons, conserves, farine de manioc, etc.) ainsi que du charbon de bois à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé ses crédits antérieurs, et même son dernier crédit malgré le décès de son mari. Afin d’augmenter les stocks de marchandises et de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, elle sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The client was born on July 19, 1970 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She is a widow who has 3 children, all enrolled in school and all still living with her. She lives alone with her children and is the breadwinner for the family. To support her children, she sells various items (snacks, cookies, bonbons, tinned goods, manioc flour, etc.) as well as charcoal out of her house. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé and she has reimbursed her prior loans and even her most recent loan, despite the death of her husband. So as to be able to add to her inventory and better satisfy the needs of her customers, she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items wholesale (soap, tins of food, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Hélénia

texts.fr: B. Hélénia est née le 20 Novembre 1977 à Kpomassè au Bénin. Hélénia est mariée à SOSSOUVE Thierry et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Hélénia vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint à Midombo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Hélénia est une coiffeuse de profession et qui vend également des mèches pour cheveux et des produits cosmétiques à Midombo. Hélénia a sept ans d’expérience dans ce métier. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que  Hélénia s’approvisionne. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Hélénia sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Hélénia was born on November 20, 1977 in Kpomassè in Bénin. Hélénia is married to SOSSOUVE Thierry and is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in school. Hélénia lives with her children and spouse in Midombo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. The couple share in supporting the family.
