Hélénia is a professional beautician who also sells hair extensions and cosmetics in Midombo. Hélénia has seven years of experience in this trade. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. Looking to expand her business and better satisfy her clientele, Hélénia is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of products for hair, hair extensions, and braids

loans.name: Maria Nakiganda's Group

texts.en:
Maria, 42, is married and has two grown children. She rents a two room house where she is staying with 10 people. The family has access to electricity but no running water.  Maria takes care of additional family members.

She has a pub selling soda and beer.  Maria uses public transport to and from shopping, and selling to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She buys soda and beer in Natete, one of the city suburbs.  

She works seven days a week. On average, she receives 30 customers a day.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala. 

Maria has been in this business 10 years and with MCDT five years. She is servicing her 11th loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, medication and rent for her home and business.  Her business challenges include the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming for a drink. 

Maria is hoping to see her business grow bigger and wants to start operating from her own home.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es: Darwin Alexis tiene 44 años, como todo padre responsable, le gusta proporcionarles a sus 2 hijos lo más básico. Su negocio consiste en la venta de refrescos naturales, la ubicación de su negocio es en su propia vivienda, además manda a una persona a vender a las calles y él se esfuerza para la elaboración de  sus frutas y así realizar la elaboración de sus refrescos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de frutas, bolsas, pajilla entre otros productos necesarios. Su deseo es establecer un negocio en el mercado para obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Darwin Alexis is 44 years old, and like all responsible parents, he wants to provide the basics for his 2 children. His business consists of selling natural drinks. His store is located in his own home. In addition, he sends a person out to sell in the streets. He prepares the fruits and makes the drinks himself.

The financing he solicits is for working capital that will be destined for the purchase of fruits, bags, and drinking straws among other necessary products. His desire is to establish a business in the public market in order to gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SUPPLIES FOR HIS NATURAL DRINKS BUSINESS

loans.name: Cyriane

texts.fr: La cliente est née le 18 Mars 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Elle est mariée et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. La cliente vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours primaire, et depuis neuf ans, elle exerce la couture et vend également des articles de mercerie au marché de Midombo. Elle achète ses articles à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The client was born on March 18, 1975 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. She is married and is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school. She helps her husband out in supporting the family. She went through primary school, but since the age of 9, she has been working at sewing, and she also sells sewing notions in the market of Midombo. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. In order to expand her business and meet the needs of her clientele, she is asking ALIDé for a first ever loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing supplies for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of motor oil and oxydized iron for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of boards to sculpt

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi K. est une femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Kpalimé une ville connue pour le cacao et le café au Togo. C’est une coiffeuse et avec ce prêt de Kiva, elle voudrait vendre les produits de l’alimentation générale aux devantures de son salon de coiffure.Afi est une femme très dévouée et très résolue et avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle voudrait construire une maison pour sa famille et un magasin de vente des produits de l'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Afi K. is a 29 year old woman, married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Kpalime a town known for its production of cocoa and coffee in Togo. She is a hairdresser and with this loan from Kiva, she would like to sell general food products in the front of her hairdo shop. Afi is very resolute and enterprising and with the profits, she would like to build a house for her family and a store for trading. FECECAV is a cooperative union created in 1995 and registered in 1997. It's mission is to serve the financial needs of local people who have been excluded from the traditional financial system. It serves more than 45,000 members in the Plateaux and Maritime regions of Togo. FECECAV is a non-profit organization.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of  Motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: R. Afiavi est née le 17 Juillet 1971 à Aného au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Mariée à KAYOSSI Joseph, un militaire,  Afiavi est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C'est depuis cinq ans que  Afiavi réside au quartier Akpakpa Sodjéatinmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Afiavi vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. A l'école, Afiavi s'est juste arrêtée au cours primaire. C'est une couturière qui vend également des tissus pour rideaux et draps depuis 11 ans, à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Afiavi fait ses approvisionnements à Lomé, capitale du Togo.  Afiavi n'a jamais obtenu de crédit de ALIDé ; elle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité en la diversifiant et accroître son fonds de roulement.  Afiavi ambitionne plus tard ouvrir sa propre boutique pour ses activités.
texts.en:
Afiavi R. was born July 17, 1971 in Aného, Togo, a neighboring country of Benin. She is married to Joseph Kayossi, a military officer. Afiavi is the mother of two children who all attend school. For five years Afiavi has lived in the Akpakpa Sodjéatinmè neighborhood of Cotonou, economical capital of Benin. Afiavi helps her husband in the family expenses. As to school, Afiavi herself quit school at the primary level. For 11 years she has been a dressmaker who also sells fabrics for curtains and sheets from her residence and through a distribution system. Afiavi purchases her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Afiavi has never obtained a loan from ALIDé before. She requests a credit from ALIDé to grow and diversify her business and increase her working capital. Afiavi aims later to open her own shop for her activities.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase curtains, sheets and kitchen implements.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: A. Adèle est née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Adèle réside au quartier Agbato à Cotonou depuis près de quarante huit ans. Adèle est mariée à un pêcheur et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple prend ensemble en charge des dépenses de la famille. Adèle n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est pourquoi depuis une vingtaine d’année, Adèle s’est livrée à la vente de crevettes et de poissons fumés. Adèle s’approvisionne sur le lac et vend ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Adèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui est à son quatrième crédit. Adèle veut pouvoir répondre efficacement à la forte demande qu’elle enregistre de la part de sa clientèle actuellement, raison pour laquelle Adèle sollicite ce crédit pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Adèle A. was born in 1960 in Cotonou, economical capital of Benin. Adèle has lived in the Agbato neighborhood of Cotonou for nearly forty eight years. Adèle is married to a fisherman and is the mother of four children who all attend school. The couple share together the family expenses. Adèle never attended school. This is the reason why for about twenty years, Adèle has devoted herself to the sale of shrimp and smoked fish. Adèle buys her supplies at the lake and sells her products in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Adèle is a former customer of ALIDé that is on her fourth loan. Adèle wants to be able to respond effectively to the strong demand for her products from her clients, which is the reason Adèle requests this loan.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh shrimp and hot drinks for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Walther

texts.en:
Our client is Walther. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. He is from Huancayo and lives in Cruz Pata. He is 48 years old and is married with 5 daughters.

He has a bakery where he makes baked good and sweet treats like cakes, apple pies, etc. He sells goods to stores and to tourists. He has many familiar customers who come continually to buy from him. He will use this loan to buy flour and other materials needed for his bakery.

Walther appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy flour and other raw materials needed for his bakery

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Abiba is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Abiba has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ajara works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. Ajara cooks and sells rice with stew. She sells by the roadside from morning till evening. She procures her ingredients from nearby towns.

Ajara has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to one son who is in school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Rakia is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Rakia sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her child the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna is seventy-seven years old. She is widowed and has given birth to eight children, all out of school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Mamuna is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Mamuna has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: K. Charlotte est née en 1979 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte est célibataire sans enfant. Charlotte n’est jamais allée à l’école ; elle fait plutôt le commerce des produits alimentaires tels que : les boîtes de tomate, de cubes, etc. Charlotte vit depuis sept ans  à Fifatin, un quartier de Cotonou. C’est  à Gbogbanou, marché de vente en gros de tous produits importés que Charlotte s’approvisionne en ces différents produits. Charlotte vend ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Charlotte a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans cette activité mais elle est à son deuxième crédit avec ALIDé. En effet, Charlotte veut mieux développer son activité, c’est pourquoi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Charlotte K. was born in 1979 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Charlotte is unmarried and without any children. Charlotte never went to school; Rather, she sells food products such as: canned tomatoes, bullion cubes, etc. Charlotte has lived for seven years in Fifatin, a neighborhood of Cotonou. Charloote buys her various products in Gbogbanou, a wholesale market of all imported products Charlotte sells her products in Dantokpa, a large international market of Benin. Charlotte already has seven years of experience in this activity, but she is on her second loan with ALIDé. In fact, Charlotte wants to grow her business. This is the reason why she requests this loan.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned tomatoes and bullion cubes for resale.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Zenabu is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and to retailers. Zenabu has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are now in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ramatu is a trader and runs a cold-store in her community. She procures fresh fish and meat from big cold-stores in nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure cartons of fresh fish in bulk.

Ramatu is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is sixty years old. He is married and has five children, all out of school. He lives with his wife and some of the children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ali is a trader and trades in cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. He procures the goods from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in his community. He has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. He is hopeful to improve upon his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Kartifou

texts.fr: I. M. Kartifou est née en 1969 à Bassila dans le Département de la Donga. Kartifou est mariée à AFFO Seydou. Kartifou et Seydou ont cinq enfants tous scolarisés mais aucun n'est encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Adogléta à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Seydou assure seul les charges de la famille. Kartifou est dans la restauration populaire. Kartifou vend en plus des savons fabriqués au Ghana, pays voisin du Bénin. Kartifou achète ses provisions pour la restauration à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Mais, c'est au Ghana que Kartifou achète ses savons. Kartifou est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé et elle rembourse bien ses prêts. Kartifou sollicite ce crédit-ci pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
I. M. Kartifou was born in 1969 in Bassila in Donga County. She is married to AFFO Seydou. She and Seydou have five children who are all schooled but no longer in their care. The family lives in Adogléta in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Seydou alone ensures that family expenses are covered. Kartifou works in basic food service. In addition, she sells soap made in Ghana, a country near Benin. She purchases her restaurant supplies in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. But Ghana is where she purchases her soap. She is on her fourth loan with ALIDé, and she does indeed repay her loans. She’s requesting this loan for bolstering her working capital in order to satisfy further the strong customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions and condiments, as well as soaps from Ghana

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Mari works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Mari is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew, selling by the roadside from morning till evening. She procures the goods from nearby towns.

Mari has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to make rice and stew

loans.name: Muani

texts.en:
Muani is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Muani works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Muani is a trader and sells provisions on a table by the roadside in her community. She procures the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Lydia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew. She sells by the road side in the afternoons. She procures the goods from nearby towns. Lydia has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other cooking ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom go to school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Afia is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. She procures fresh fish and meat from big cold storage places in nearby towns. Afia supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure cartons of fresh fish and meat in bulk. Afia is hopeful of improving upon her standard of living and wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish & meat in bulk

loans.name: Guillermo Noel

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo C. es muy esforzado porque se dedica a su negocio de venta de celulares y de repuestos de celulares teniendo su propio negocio en el departamento de Chinandega en el mercado el bisne.

Inició su negocio con pocos productos pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo, ha mejorado las condiciones del negocio. Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los repuestos de celulares y así continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
Guillermo C. is very hardworking and dedicated to his business selling cellular phones and phone parts. He owns this business, located in a street market in the department of Chinandega. He started his business with only a few products, but with time he has made many improvements. Guillermo has approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy cellular parts and thus continue his work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone parts.

loans.name: Christin Gisèle

texts.fr: L. Christin Gisèle est mariée à DJIDONOU Nicolas, un menuiser. Christin Gisèle et Nicolas ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés mais aucun n'est encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Sègbèya à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Christin Gisèle et Nicolas assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. C'est les produits vivriers (haricot rouge et blanc, riz, maïs, sorgho, mil, farine de manioc, etc.) que Christin Gisèle vend. Christin Gisèle achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Christin Gisèle a eu déjà un crédit de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé. Christin Gisèle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
L. Christin Gisèle is married to JIDONOU Nicolas, who is a furniture maker. She and Nicolas have four children who are all schooled but no longer in their care. The family lives in Sègbèya in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Christin Gisèle and Nicolas jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. What Christin Gisèle sells are staple foods (red and white beans, rice, corn, sorghum, millet, cassava flour, etc.). She purchases her goods in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She has had an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid. She’s requesting this second loan to develop her business further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, rice, bean, beans, and cassava flour

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es:
En el mercado el bisne del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Regino Francisco O. se dedica a la actividad del sector transporte en su triciclo transportando personas de una localidad a otra a un precio modico y de esta manera se gana la vida para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El problema que él atraviesa hoy en día es que su triciclo se ha dañado y requiere cambio de llantas y neumático y por este motivo solicita crédito en Ceprodel para comprar las llantas y el neumático y seguir en su actividad.
texts.en:
At the Bisne Market in the department of Chinandega, Sr. Regino Francisco O. works in the transportation sector. In order to provide for his family, he offers to transport people from one location to another in his tricycle for a reasonable price.

Regino’s tricycle was damaged, so he is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that he can replace the tires and bicycle rims. This will enable him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & rims for his tricycle

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
En el mercado el bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Isabel V. se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosas tortillas las cuales son vendidas por ella misma siendo muy visitada por los clientes que compran las tortillas.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio y beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo para mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
At the Bisne Market in the department of Chinandega, Sra. Isabel V. is known for making delicious tortillas. She sells them to customers who come visit her.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients, such as corn. This will enable her to continue improving her business and also help her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Sèdé

texts.fr: A. Sèdé est née en 1961 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Sèdé est mariée à MELONOU Jean, un cuisinier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés mais non plus à sa charge. La famille vit à Fifatin à Cotonou. C'est les divers (boîtes de conserve, pâtes alimentaires, bicarbonate, éponge en fer, bougies, etc.)que Sèdé vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Sèdé achète ses produits à Gbogbanou, marché de vente en gros des produits importés. Sèdé a déjà eu un crédit de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé. Sèdé sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Sèdé was born in 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to MELONOU Jean, who is a cook. The couple has four children who are all schooled but no longer dependents of theirs. The family lives in Fifatin in Cotonou. Sèdé sells a variety of goods (canned food, pasta, bicarbonate, metal scrubbers, candles, etc.) at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She purchases her goods in Gbogbanou, a market selling imported goods in bulk. She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. She’s requesting this second loan for bolstering her working capital in order to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (canned food, pasta, toilet paper, etc.)

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.es:
MARIA CRISTINA L. D.;  tiene 26 años, convive con su pareja y tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 2 años.  Desde hace cuatro meses,  ella pertenece al grupo “Mujeres Latinas” junto a 9 integrantes mas, residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
Hace un año, la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de tubérculos en el Mercado de nombre “Universitaria”, prácticamente heredó  el puesto de su padre, desde entonces ella madruga todos los días y a las tres de la mañana empieza a alistarse para ir a comprar su mercadería al Mercado Mayorista, dejando a sus hijos al cuidado de su pareja.
Con sus ingresos ha iniciado la construcción del segundo piso que les cedió  su suegra en su casa, y aparte apoya en los gastos familiares como en el pago de los servicios de luz y agua.
Como nos manifiesta la Sra., María, éste es un trabajo muy sacrificado pero tiene su recompensa, por ello trabaja mucho y le gustaría poder más adelante comprar un carro que le sirva para prestar servicio de taxi.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará para aumentar su mercadería y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina L. D. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, ages 10 and 2. For the past four months she has belonged to the "Mujeres Latinas" ("Latin Women") Group along with nine other members, all residents of the district of Carabayllo. For the past year Maria has made a living selling tubers in the market called "Universitaria" ("University"). She practically inherited the sales post from her father and since then she wakes up before dawn everyday and at 3 in the morning she starts to list what she needs to buy at the wholesale market, leaving her children in the care of her husband. With her profits she has started building a second floor on the home given to her by her mother-in-law, and also help out with family expenses like the water and electric bill. Maria tells us this is very tough work but it has its rewards, so she works a lot and in the future she would like to buy a car that she can use for a taxi service. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her merchandise and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: Sergio Antonio A. A.  reside en el municipio de Cuscatancingo del departamento de San Salvador, Sergio tiene 36 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hijo de 16 años estudiante. El sr. se dedica de lleno a su negocio, donde da servicios de encuadernación, anillados y empastados, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en la alcaldía de San Salvador, ya que esa zona es muy conocida por la variedad de papelerías y diversos servicios relacionados, el negocio de Sergio se destaca por la calidad de sus trabajos y costos bajos de sus servicios, este crédito que el solicita es para invertir en materiales que necesita para prestar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Sergio Antonio A. A. lives in the town of Cuscatancingo, department of San Salvador. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their son, a 16-year-old student. Sergio is fully dedicated to his business, which provides bookbinding services with ring and glue options. The business is located at San Salvador's city hall, an area well known for its variety of stationery stores and other related services. Sergio's business stands out thanks to the quality of its work and the low prices of its services. He is requesting this loan to purchase materials he needs to carry out his services.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his business

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.es: Ambrocio C. C. de 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango del departamento de San Salvador. Ambrocio vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Oscar de 18 años de edad y Jesica de 8 años. El es un padre ejemplar, responsable con su familia, para Ambrosio es muy importante apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que como experiencia propia ha vivido las dificultades de no tener una educación escolar y lo difícil que es conseguir un empleo bien remunerado, es por ello que él trabaja día a día para darle una mejor oportunidad a sus hijos, Ambrocio maneja su propio negocio una venta de camisas ubicada en el centro de San Salvador, el destino del crédito que el solicita es para surtir su local variedad de ropa para poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ambrocio C. C., 48, lives in the municipality of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Ambrocio lives with his wife and two children: Oscar, 18, and Jesica, 8. He is an exemplar and responsible father; to Ambrocio it is very important to support his children educationally because he himself has experienced the difficulties that result from not having an academic education and not obtaining a well-paying job. This is why Ambrocio works every day - to give his children the opportunity to succeed. Ambrocio manages his own business selling shirts in downtown San Salvador. He will use the loan he is requesting to stock his store with a variety of clothes in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking his business

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María O. reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposa y sus dos hijo de 18 y 17 años de edad. Hace cinco años José instalo una tienda en su domicilio, tras la necesidad de conseguir una manera estable de sostener a su familia, ya que en años anteriores José solo lograba conseguir trabajos temporales, los cuales le daban un desequilibrio en los gastos de su hogar, ahora el maneja su propio negocio en el cual, es él,  el motor que hace funcionar su tienda, la que ofrece variedad de productos para el hogar, pero ahora esta solicitando de este crédito para surtir de mercadería que no posee y que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
José María O. lives in the department of La Libertad with his wife and two children, who are 17 and 18 years old. Five years ago, José started running a store from his home because he needed a way to steadily support his family. Previously, José could only obtain temporary jobs, which would result in uneven expenditures for the home. Now, he manages his own business and he is the engine running his store, which offers a variety of products for the home. José is now requesting this loan to stock his store with products he doesn't have and that his customers are requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking his business

loans.name: Zoila Cristina

texts.es: Zoila Cristina M. D. M. vive con madre, esposo y su hija Gabriela D. 16 años, la familia M. residen en el departamento D. San Salvador. Es increíble como Zoila es reconocida por muchos clientes, por su  admirable empeño por salir adelante, son ya 26 años los que Zoila tiene D. poseer su negocio, la mitad D. su vida dedicada a vender en su puesto que se ubica actualmente en el mercado central, ella ofrece variedad D. ropa para niños y ropa interior para niños, damas y caballeros, el deseo D. Zoila es aprovechar al máximo los meses que se aproximan ya que su demanda se ve aumentada en época naviD.ña es para ello que solicita D. este crédito que le permita  surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila Cristina M. D. M. lives with her mother, her husband, and her daughter Gabriela, who is 16 years old. The M. family lives in the department of San Salvador. It is amazing to see how Zoila is being recognized by many customers for her admirable drive to succeed. She has owned her clothes selling business for 26 years (half her life!), where she sells a wiD. variety of children's clothing, lingerie, and children's and men's undergarments. Zoila wishes to take advantage of the coming months, since demand for her products increases during the holiday season. Zoila requests this loan to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business

loans.name: Ana Marixa

texts.es: Ana Marixa G. es una mujer separada de su pareja sentimental, tiene 37 años edad, vive con su madre quien es una persona de edad avanzada  la cual necesita de los cuidos y atenciones de Ana, ella maneja su propio negocio en un mercado de San Salvador, donde vende ropa para damas y caballeros, con los ingresos que Ana genera logra absorber los pagos fijos del hogar, pero en estos últimos meses Ana se ha visto en la necesidad de generar más ingresos ya que sus madre con frecuencia necesita de medicinas y pago de transporte para movilizarla a sus consultas, es por ello que Ana solicita un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de seguir ampliando su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Ana Marixa G. is separated from her domestic partner, is 37 years old, and lives with her mother, an older person in need of Ana's care and attention. She runs her own business in the San Salvador market, selling women's and men's clothing. With what she earns, Ana takes care of her home's fixed expenses, but lately, she has had greater income need, as her mother frequently needs to get medicine and to pay for the transportation to go to doctors' appointments. Ana is requesting a loan that would allow her to continue expanding her business and increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business

loans.name: Manos Telarañas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SILVANA C. R. D. C., es casada D. 52 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos estudiantes universitarios.
La Sra.Silvana se dedica a la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir D. tejido,al igual que las otras 6 intregrantes del Grupo "Manos Telarañas"

Hace 4 años,inició vendiendo en un centro comercial,lo cual no le daba muchas ganancias, fue asi que se animó a acondicionar en un espacio D. su casa un lugar para confeccionar sus propias prendas, inició con la costura, pero eso tiene sus temporadas bajas como en en invierno, y luego incursiona en el trabajo D. tejidos a mano aprovechando ésta  estación.
Le gusta mucho viajar y su trabajo le ha permitido conocer algunos lugares del país. Su sueño es tener una boutique propia.
El prestamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para la campaña naviD.ña. Va a comprar sus materiales D. trabajo, es decir hilos para preparar boleros y politos  para la estación D. verano, botones y así preparar un stock D. prendas para iniciar su campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvana C. Reaño D. C. is 52 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in college. Silvana makes knitted outfits, as do the six other members of the Manos Telarañas ("Spiderweb Hands") Group. Four years ago, she got started in sales at a commercial center, which wasn't very profitable, so she decided to set up a space in her home where she could sew her own clothing. She started out sewing, but found that there were slow seasons, primarily in winter, so she decided to take advantage of that season to make hand-knit clothing. She enjoys traveling, and her work has allowed her to get to know different parts of the country. Her dream is to open her own boutique. The requested loan will be used to buy merchandise for the Christmas season. She will buy more material to work with, like yarn to knit t-shirts and bolero tops for the summer season, and buttons to start knitting items for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy knitting materials

loans.name: Working In Harmony Group

texts.es:
DesD. muy jovencita Victoria Gómez  era dedicada a los estudios es así que pudo tener una carrera como auxiliar contable se dedico a trabajar en una empresa por mucho tiempo lamentablemente esta empresa quebró y  debido a ello quedo sin trabajo,  por esa misma época consigue un terreno en santa Ana los Olivos un lugar nuevo donD. iba a empezar D. cero, con la mudanza D. lo que seria su nuevo hogar también había la preocupación que buscar una forma D. ganarse la vida, es así  que pensando en un negocio sale al mercado que estaba en una calle cerca D. su nueva casa y empieza en el negocio  venta D.  especerías (ají , condimentos, aderezos molidos. etc.)
Al inicio le fue mal pero poco a poco fue ganando clientela lo mas difícil para ella era vender informalmente pues era riesgoso vender en la calle,  tener que sacar y guardar sus cosas todos los días era doble trabajo, por otro lado los policías municipales los echaban del lugar muchas veces quitándoles su mercadería. Para ella era un dolor D. cabeza realmente fueron momentos muy difíciles es por ello que deciden agruparse y formalizarse compran un local granD. para el mercado y con mucho sacrificio y ahorro adquiere su propio puesto D. especerías, ahora se siente feliz pues tiene su propio negocio en un lugar bonito y seguro. Por las tardes cuando cierra el mercado también se ayuda con otro negocio D. venta D. comidas (anticuchos  y  parrilladas) ubicado en su casa.
Victoria realmente es muy trabajadora  todo lo que hace es  por sus hijos a quienes ella sola a podido darles una buena educación  su esfuerzo es doble porque no tiene la ayuda D. su esposo por que es separada lo cual es doble merito, con su préstamo va a comprar mas especias para vender y lo que  mas desea en el futuro es comprarse otro puesto en el mismo mercado para eso esta ahorrando D. sol en sol sabe que lo lograra por eso trabaja sin descansar.

*la Señora Victoria aparece en la foto parada detras con chompa a cuadros en blanco y negro
texts.en:
From a young age, Victoria Gómez devoted herself to her studies so that she could have a career as an accountant. She went to work for a company and became a long-time employee. Unfortunately, she lost her job when her employer went bankrupt. Around the same time, she acquired a piece of property in Santa Ana Los Olivos so that she could start over. While moving into her new home, Victoria worried about how she was going to earn a living. During a visit to a street market near her new home, she thought of starting a business selling condiments (chili peppers, spices, ground seasonings, etc.).

Her business started off badly. She gradually gained a few customers, but being an informal street merchant is a risky proposition. Having to acquire and guard her merchandise created double work for Victoria. The municipal police would often come by and throw out her merchandise instead of asking her to remove it. This created headaches for her because she had to deciD. between making a large purchase of inventory or make the sacrifice to save enough money to acquire her own spice stand. Fortunately, Victory is happy to have her own business in an area that is well-kept and secure. In the afternoons after the market closes, she opens her other business selling food (grilled and roasted meats) outsiD. of her home.

Victoria continues to work hard so that she can proviD. her children with a good education. She feels she has to work extra hard because she is separated from her husband and does not have the luxury of a second income. Her loan will be used to buy more spices to sell. One of her greatest goals is to acquire another vending post in the same market, so Victoria is saving as much money as possible and working as long as she can without resting.

In the photo, Victoria is the woman standing in the back wearing a black and white checkered sweater.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Xenia Marisol

texts.es: Xenia Marisol  G. originaria del departamento de Chalatenango. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas  Lorena de 12 años de edad y Saúl de 8 de edad, ambos niños estudian. El esposo de Xenia trabaja como motorista, él ha ayudado a su esposa a montar este pequeño negocio, con el cual Xenia ayuda a su esposo en los pagos del hogar, a pesar de hacer invertido sus ahorros para instalar su tienda, no fueron suficientes para poderla surtir plenamente, es por ello que Xenia solicita de un crédito que le ayude a invertir en variedad y cantidad de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Xenia Marisol G. is originally from the department of Chalatenango. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children, Lorena (age 12) and Saúl (age 8). Her husband works as a taxi driver and helped her establish a small business. This enables Xenia to help him with the household expenses. Even though they were able to open their store through the use of their savings, the couple does not have sufficient income to keep their business fully stocked. For this reason, Xenia is requesting a loan to help her acquire a variety of merchandise in large quantities for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inventory for her business

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa C. de 41 años de edad reside en el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad con su familia que está compuesta por su esposo de 61 años de edad quien se encuentra jubilado y sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 14 años de edad. María es una persona muy alegre en su hogar y su negocio,  hace unos años empezó con su tortillería a raíz del de la jubilación de su esposo, María tuvo la idea de iniciar su propio negocio en el cual ella podría aportar económicamente al hogar, y es así como ahora con once años de experiencia en su negocio le han dado el éxito de una clientela estable y gran demanda es por eso que ahora solicita de un crédito para comprar insumos y aumentar la producción de tortillas diarias
texts.en:
María Teresa C. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. Her husband is 61 years old and retired. The couple has three children (ages 17, 16, and 14). María is a cheerful person who started her tortilla business a few years ago shortly after her husband’s retirement. She was inspired to start her own business so that she could continue supporting her family financially. María has now been in business for eleven years and attributes her success to a stable clientele and high demand. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her daily production of tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her tortilla business

loans.name: Danys Edgardo

texts.es: Danys Edgardo M. C. originario del departamento de La Libertad vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 meses de nacido. Danys tiene 26 años de edad, el siempre se ha dedicado al comercio de productos posee una experiencia de ocho años en dicha actividad, ya que desde muy joven se quedo viviendo solo, porque su madre se fue a Estados Unidos por el deseo de superación económica para la familia, dichas circunstancias han hecho de Danys un hombre responsable y trabajador, actualmente se ha dedicado a vender perfumes, aunque su inventario es muy escaso, es por eso que solicita de un crédito para invertir en mercadería para salir a vender de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Danys Edgardo M. C., originally from the Department of La Libertad, El Salvador, lives with his wife and his 6 month-old son. Danys is 26 years old and has always been dedicated to the business of selling products. He has 8 years of experience in this activity since he has lived alone since he was very young because his mother went to the U.S. because of her desire to help improve her family's economic situation. These circumstances have made Danys a responsible and hard-working man. Currently he works selling perfumes, although his inventory is low. That is why he requests a credit in order to invest in merchandise that he will sell as a walking salesman.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna Elizabeth C. de 50 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad, ella vive con su esposo en casa propia, en el domicilio de Mirna también se encuentra su negocio es una taller de costura y venta de ropa fabricadas en el taller de Mirna y diseñadas por ella, Mirna le da empleo a una señora que trabaja con ella en la confección de ropa, también posee un inventario de productos varios como colas para el cabello , cremas para el cuerpo, cosméticos, entre otros; los cuales los tiene en un pequeño mostrador a la entrada de su negocio. Mirna solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más variedades de tela, para utilizarla en la elaboración de sus diseños que  tienen gran demanda y aceptación de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth C. is 50 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad in El Salvador. She lives with her husband in her own house. In Mirna's house one also finds her business, which is a sewing shop which sells clothes that she makes and designs herself. Mirna employs a woman that works with her in the making of clothing. She also possesses an inventory of various products like hair clips and barrettes, body creams, and cosmetics, among other items, which she shows in a little display at the entrance to her business. Mirna requests this credit in order to buy more varieties of fabric to elaborate her designs which are in great demand and very popular with her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric in order to make new clothing designs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro M. S. reside en el municipio de San Martin del departamento de San Salvador. Pedro se encuentra separado de la madre sus hijos, actualmente sus dos hijos viven con él,  Peter de 15 años de edad y David de 9 años de edad ambos estudiantes. Pedro inicio su negocio tras la experiencia que había ganado como empleado en muchas fabricas donde sus capacidades eran explotadas y poco remuneradas, ahora él ha instalado un negocio de confección y estampados para todo tipo de ropa, en la fotografía aparece Pedro con su herramienta vital de trabajo, es la maquina llamada “pulpo” en la cual se colocan varias camisas para ser estampadas, el crédito que solicita Pedro es para invertirlo en camisas al por mayor, así lograr adquirir un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Pedro M. S. lives in the San Martin municipality in the San Salvador department. Pedro is separated from the mother of his children. He currently has two children who live with him. Peter is 15, and David is 9. Both of them go to school. Pedro worked in many factories, where his talents were exploited and poorly compensated. He used this experience to start his business. He has now set up a business making all types of clothes including printed shirts. In the photograph Pedro is shown with the tool that is vital to his work. It is called a “pulpo”. The shirts are placed on it in order to be printed. The loan Pedro is asking for is to buy shirts wholesale. That way he gets a greater margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts wholesale

loans.name: Idalia Margarita

texts.es:
la señora Idalia Margarita G. R. tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos que estudian  y dependen de ella a un 100%, vive en la colonia obrera de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Idalia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, calzado y cameras, las vende al por mayor y al detalle, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años y esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar ropa como ser jeans, faldas, zapatos y tenis para damas y caballeros. 
Idalia desea abastecerce de prodcuto para la epoca navideña que empieza el otro mes. 
su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y que sus ventas mejoren para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Idalia Margarita G. R. is 33 years old, is single and has three children in school who depend on her 100%. She lives in a working class neighborhood of San Lorenzo. Idalia buys and sells clothes, shoes and cameras. She sells them on a wholesale and retail basis. For the last 7 years she has been in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as jeans, skirts, shoes and sneakers for women and men. Idalia would like to purchase the new supplies for the Christmas season that begins in a month. Her dream is to grow her business and improve sales so that she can achieve a better quality of life for herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and clothing for men and women

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
la señora Silvia P. O. tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija que depende de ella al 100%, Silvia es originaria de Coyolito, Amapala.
en su casa de habitacion tiene su negocio que es una venta de ropa y zapatos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace unos 10 años. 
con el cual ha podido salir adelante,  su compañero de hogar la dejo hace unos tres meses, mas sin embargo ella esta decidida a salir adelante sola. Esta solicitando un prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia y asi estar preparada para la epoca de navidad, porque para esos dias muchas personas compran ropa nueva para sus hijos. sus ventas las realiza con los pobladores de la aldea ya que es el unico negocio de este tipo cerca de la zona en donde ella vive, es por esta razon que sus ventas son muy buenas.
texts.en:
34 year old Silvia is a single mother whose daughter depends on one hundred percent. Silvia is originally from Coyolito, Amapala.

She runs a business selling clothes and shoes from her home and has been doing this for some ten years. With this business, she has been able to get by successfully. Her partner left her three months ago, but she is determined to be successful by herself. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in order to be ready for the Christmas season because many people buy new clothes for their children to wear at Christmas. She makes her sales to the local villagers, and her sales are very good because hers is the only business of this type in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell - blouses, shirts, children's shoes, dresses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Beatriz E. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene vario tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el cual le ha dado todo lo que tiene, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que este es un alimento que se consume mucho en nuestro pais, las tortillas aparte de ser muy sabrosas son el acompañante en todas las comidas (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). es por eso que este tipo de alimento es bien vendido.
Beatriz esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas materia prima al por mayor para tener una mayor produccion ya que ahora no se da abasto y su producto se le termina rapido, tiene las esperanzas que su produccion va a crecer y sus ventas van a mejorar mucho. 
tiene el espiritu de una mujer trabajadora. estando con ella nos dio a probar una de sus tortillas y son muy buenas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz E. earns a living making and selling tortillas. She has time to devote herself to this kind of activity, which has given her all that she has. Her sales are very good, due in part to the food that is consumed in her country. Tortillas, in addition to being very delicious are the mainstay in all meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner). It is for this reason she sells this type of food. Beatriz is asking for a loan to be able to buy wholesale the raw materials needed to have a major production, now that the supplies are being used up quickly. She hopes that her production is going to grow and her sales will improve a lot. She has the spirit of a hardworking woman. While being with her, she gave us one of her tortillas to taste and they are delicious.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood, corn, lime and water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Scarlatas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group which is called Scarlatas. Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town located north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure of concrete and tin as a single mother of three grown children who are dependent on her income. 

Sonia is excited to take this first loan with Esperanza with the goal of improving her herbal medicine business. She runs her business from her house and with this loan she will purchase more ingredients for her herbal remedies. She is hoping to use the profits from this business to help her children to find a better future and to continue growing her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Suyapa Concepcion A. O. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, tiene mucha experiencia haciendo tortillas.
su producto lo vende en diferentes zonas cercanas a su casa de habitacion, tambien lo reparte en pulperias, siempre los fines de semana le encargan para reuniones y fiestas, normalmente en las reuniones de fines de semana la comida que se prepara es la carne asada, frijoles fritos, queso, chismol, aguacate etc, y con este sabroso plato de comida no pueden faltar las tortillas que son el complemento especial para este tipo de comida.
se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien.
su meta en un futuro es poder remodelar su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Suyapa Concepcion A. O. is in the business of making and selling tortillas. This is her only source of income, and she has a great deal of experience making tortillas. She sells her product in different areas near her residence, and also distributes it to small stores. Every weekend she receives orders for gatherings and parties. Normally at these weekend gatherings the food prepared is grilled beef, refried beans, cheese, salsa, avocadoes etc. With this tasty dish there must be no lack of tortillas, which are the special complement for this type of food.

She feels very happy now that things are going well for her. Her goal is to be able to remodel her house and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jhon Carlos

texts.en:
Jhon Carlos B. C. is 22 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. Paraiso is a peri-urban, marginalized zone (between the suburbs and the countryside) without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.  Although Jhon is young, he has taken on very mature responsibilities.  He has purchased a simple home for himself and his two younger brothers.  The three brothers left their parents in the countryside in search of better opportunities.  Living in the city has allowed Jhon to develop an in-home "butcher shop", where he sells chickens.  With a better school system in the city, Jhon decided to raise and support his brothers, who are in 6th and 9th grade.

Jhon is requesting a loan to buy chickens.  With this loan he will be able to buy a larger quantity, at a discounted rate.  In the future, he would like to buy sheet metal to secure the roof of his home. He is grateful for any support we can provide his business so that his family may prosper!

loans.use: to buy chickens in quantity

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina A. reside en el departamento de Cuscatlán. María tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su hijo José de 21 años y  su hermana. Hace cuatro años María se está dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la que realiza de manera ambulante, ella viaje a diferentes pueblos para ofrecer sus prendas a precios muy accesibles, sus ganancias son diarias, pero María ahora solicita de un crédito, el que utilizara para hacerle mejoras a su hogar, que se encuentra descuidado, entre las remodelaciones ha optado por construirle paredes aun cuarto ya que hasta el día de ahora solo son cortinas de tela , el deseo de María es poder arreglar su hogar y poder pasar una navidad con su familia en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
María Cristina A. lives in the Cuscatlan region. Maria is 46 years old and lives with her son Jose, who is 21, and her sister. For 4 years she has been engaged in the business of selling clothes. She sells clothes in the street, traveling to different towns to offer her garments at prices that are very affordable, and her business generates daily earnings. But now Maria is requesting a loan that she will use to make improvements to her house, which is in run-down condition. For the remodeling project, she has chosen to construct walls where currently there are only fabric curtains. Maria's wish is to fix her house and to be able to enjoy a Christmas with her family in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to remodel her home

loans.name: Maria Jenoveba

texts.es: Maria Jenoveba G. de 65 años de edad reside en el departamento de san Salvador. Es madre soltera, solo tuvo una hija, quien corrió con la misma desdicha de su madre, no contar con el apoyo económico del padre de su hija Gabriela de 9 años de edad, quien ahora vive con su abuelita María que cuida de ella, María recibe remesas por parte de su hija que se encuentra fuera del país. María y su nieta se apoyan mutuamente en las actividades del negocio, María ha instalado una tienda en su casa donde vende toda variedad de productos para el hogar, ella solicita de un crédito para comprar productos al por mayor, ya que de esas manera obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Jenoveba G. is 65 years old and lives in the San Salvador region. She is a single mother of one daughter, who, like her mother, has had the misfortune of not being able to count on financial support from the father of her child. So, María's nine-year-old granddaughter Gabriela now lives with her while her daughter lives abroad and sends money for her support.

María has a shop in her home where she sells all kinds of household products. She and her granddaughter support each other in running the business. María is seeking a loan to purchase wholesale products for her shop in order to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Delma Rosa

texts.es:
la joven Delma Rosa S. se dedica a la confeccion de vestidos, blusas, camisas de vestir, pantalones, sacos, toda la ropa que ella elabora es para dama.
este tipo de actividad le gusto desde pequeña, ya que siempre miraba programas de moda y revistas de moda cuando estaba niña, esto le creo una inclinacion para que sacara cursos de confeccion y se dedicara a este tipo de actividad.
ahora muchas personas la buscan para que les elabore ropa, todos sus clientes estan satisfechos con el trabajo que ella hace, dicen que la ropa les queda a la medida y que sus diseños son muy bonitos.
ahora Delma esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas telas ya que viene la temporada navideña y tiene muchos encargos. se siente muy feliz de poder haber montado su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The young Delma Rose S. is dedicated to making dresses, blouses, dress shirts, pants, and bags. All the clothes that she makes are for ladies. She has enjoyed this type of activity since she was small, since she always watched fashion programs and read fashion magazines when she was a girl. This gave her the inclinacion to take dressmaking courses and she dedicated herself to this type of activity. Now many people seek her out to make clothes for them. All her clients are satisfied with the work that she does. They say that the clothes are custom-made styles and that her designs are very pretty. Now Delma is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fabrics, since the Christmas season approaches and she has many assignments. She feels very happy to be able to have developed her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics of all types, threads of various colors, buttons, laces, decorative edging, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es: José Mario B. residente del departamento de La Libertad vive a su junt esposa. José tiene un pequeño carro de carga en el cual hace sus negocios todos los días, el se dedica a la compra y recolección de materiales es, decir chatarra, la cual el luego distribuye y ofrece a diferentes fabricas que reúsan cierto tipos de materiales, ahora el solicita de un crédito para comprar plástico, ya que muchos de sus potenciales clientes le piden este tipo de material.
texts.en:
José Mario B. lives with his wife in the Department of La Libertad. Jose has a small cargo vehicle, which he uses for his daily work. He purchases and collects recycled materials, which he then distributes and offers to different factories that reuse certain types of materials. The requested loan will be used to buy plastic, since this material is requested by many of his potential customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy recycled plastic to resell

loans.name: María Celia

texts.es: María Celia R. reside en el municipio de Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. María tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y vive solamente con su madre. María tiene veinte años de experiencia en su negocio, ha montado una venta de tamales, una costumbre de generación, ya que su madre era antes la que llevaba adelante el negocio y ahora es María, quien se dedica a la elaboración de los mismos, pero ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito para insumos utilizados en su negocio, como maíz, pollo y otros.
texts.en:
María Celia R. lives in the Colon municipality in the La Libertad department. María is 43 years old, is single, and lives just with her mother. María has been working in her business for twenty years, which is the sale of tamales (a regional food). This business is a family tradition – previously her mother ran it, but now it is María who makes her living from making the tamales. She is seeking a loan to buy her business's ingredients, such as corn, chicken, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for cooking tamales (food)

loans.name: Pacajes Group

texts.es: Artesanía en hojalata,  confección de ropa,  trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de CDS, tapicería son algunos de los negocios de las integrantes del grupo Pacajes que se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Juan Pablo II. Dirigidas por su presidenta FeL. C. elaboran su reglamento interno, están juntas hace aproximadamente 4 años, ellas han visto en Pro Mujer una oportunidad para hacer crecer sus negocios, ahora requieren del préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima o insumos, de esta manera diversificar sus productos  y mejorar sus ingresos  para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tin handicrafts, clothing production, blanket weaving, clothing sales, transportation services, CD sales, and carpet weaving are a few of the businesses run by the members of the Pacajes group, which meetings every two weeks in the Focal Juan Pablo II center. Directed by FeL. C., the president, they create their own internal management policies. They have been together approximately four year, and have already seen that working with Pro Mujer is an opportunity to develop their businesses. They need this current loan to buy merchandise, supplies, or services in order to diversify their products and increase their revenues in order to improve their children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, supplies, and services

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
La señora Aura Estela R. posee su propio negocio de pulpería el cuál es atendido por ella misma en su establecimiento ubicado en el mercado El bisne del departamento de Chinandega donde atiende a diario ofreciendo los productos varios como jabones, ase, gaseosas, huevos y otros comestibles ofreciéndolos a todos sus clientes que le visitan.

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería y así continuar en su actividad para lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes que a diario le visitan para comprar los productos ofrecidos en la pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora Aura Estela R. owns her own convenience store which is attended by herself in her establishment located in the El bisne market of the department of Chinandega. There she attends daily offering various products such as soaps, cleaning products, carbonated waters, eggs and other foods, offering them to all the clients that visit her. At present, she has responded to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of the products for the store and thus to continue in her business to achieve the satisfaction of her clients that daily visit her to buy the products offered in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria's home-based beauty supply retail business was started out of her desire to begin something on her own, proving to herself that she could succeed and earn money on her own. For five years, she has been testing the waters by selling skin care products in her native country, the Philippines. She now plans to start in the United States, since seeing that she has had success abroad.

In the Philippines, Maria's family manages her registered store, and she uses the income to support them. This business has been important for her family's well-being. In the past, they relied on her for remittances from the United States. They now feel empowered by being part of a business that they help to run.

Maria is ambitious and very determined. She wants to sell her products around the world, but plans to start in the U.S. The products she currently sells are new to the market, and she has been testing them out with her customers for two years, putting a lot of time into skin care product education.

loans.use: Inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Isabel De La Concepción

texts.es:
La venta de refrescos es la actividad a la que se dedica la señora Isabel de la Concepción A. estando ubicada en uno de los tramos del mercado El Bisne donde vende sus refrescos elaborados por ella misma.

Actualmente, ella ha solicitado el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas para elaborar los refrescos con el fin de ofrecerlos a sus clientes para aumentar sus ventas y así continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
The sale of refreshments is the activity to which Señora Isabel de la Concepción A. is dedicated. Her business is located in one of the sections of the El Bisne market, where she sells her elaborate refreshments by herself. At present, she has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits to make the refreshments, in order to offer them to her clients, increase her sales and thus to continue earning a living for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials (fruits) to make refreshments for sale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos que en estos momentos cuenta con 53 años de edad vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la zona sureste de la localidad, Carlos vive junto a su hijo de 22 años. Carlos se dedica desde hace varios años atrás a la carpintería, realiza todo tipo de trabajo al respecto. Su taller lo tiene en la misma casa donde vive. La verdad que la competencia es mediana, esto por el hecho de que existen otros carpinteros, pero por su experiencia, ubicación, calidad y puntualidad en su trabajo tiene muchos clientes. Carlos también cuenta con una moto la cuál renta diariamente por lo que recibe un ingreso seguro. Carlos con el crédito compró una computadora marca lG en $us. 720.- el resto del dinero lo invirtió en la compra de brocas y madera. Este es el tercer préstamo de Carlos y todos los anteriores los ha cancelado puntualmente. No tiene crédito en ninguna otra financiera.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is currently 53 years old, lives in his own house, located in the south-east zone of his community. Carlos lives with his 22-year-old son. For many years, Carlos has made his living from the trade of carpentry, and he performs all kinds of related jobs. His workshop is located in the house where he lives. Truthfully, he has substantial competition because there are other carpenters, but because of his experience, location, quality, and punctuality with his work, he has a lot of clients. Carlos also owns a motorcycle, which he rents daily, in order to receive regular revenue. Carlos used his loan to buy a 1G brand computer for $720 and used the rest of the money for the purchase of drill bits and wood. This is Carlo's third loan, and he paid off all his previously loans punctually. He has not received a loan from any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy stews and meat for her business

loans.name: Petronila Fatima

texts.es:
En el Mercado El Bisne de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Petronila P. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a atender su negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas y jugos y también elabora refrescos naturales para la venta.

Ella se ha destacado por ser muy buena vendedora ya que labora todos los días con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación que tanto requiere de su apoyo para continuar mejorando la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Petronila P. sells beverages such as soft drinks, juices, and natural juices that she makes herself at the El Bisne market in Managua. She has been an outstanding salesperson who works daily in order to earn income for family expenses and to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Francisco Javier P. le está haciendo falta cambiar el piso ya que el que tiene actual mente es de vinil y está en muy malas condiciones, y quiere que su familia tenga su casa en buenas condiciones ya que es donde viven. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora, ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario.
Don Francisco trabaja en una compañía  de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de montacargas, es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
The vinyl floor in Mr. Francisco Javier P.'s house needs to be replaced with ceramic tile because it is in very bad condition and he wants his family to live in a house that has good living conditions. He is asking for this loan to buy building materials and to pay the person who will do the installation since he does not presently count with sufficient funds. Francisco is employed by a transportation company as a fork lift driver and he will use part of his salary to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change his vinyl floor to ceramic tile.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, el señor Luis Manuel M. se ha dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria por medio de la siembra agrícola en sus tierras y también a la crianza de cerdos en su localidad siendo esta actividad la que le permite obtener ingresos para beneficiar a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos que dependen de él. 

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para engorde de los cerdos (lechones) para proceder a su respectiva crianza y a la vez mejorar las condiciones agrícolas que posee. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado sin problemas y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de su actividad agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel M. has been a farmer and has raised livestock in the El Viejo de Chinandega municipality. Through farming and raising pigs he is able to earn income which benefits his family which is made up of his wife and two dependent children. He came to Ceprodel to ask for funds to buy feed for his pigs so that he may fatten them up and to improve the farming conditions he has. He is confident that his loan will be granted without any problem thereby improving his farming conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piglets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan S. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo invertir en comprar mercancía.
Nueva mente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de invierno ya que no tiene suficiente y sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ropa y zapatos para la temporada de frío. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos que están estudiando ya desea que terminen una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Juan S. is grateful for his previous loan which he used to buy merchandise. He is again asking for funds to buy Winter merchandise since he does not have enough inventory to meet his customers' needs who are requesting cold weather shoes and clothing. He plans to repay his loan with part of his business earnings since he has two children who are students and he wants them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Winter merchandise.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo M. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el préstamo anterior el cual le ayudo mucho a que su negocio creciera y tuviera las herramientas necesaria.
Desea iniciar un nuevo negocio de lavado de auto hay mismo en su negocio de la vulcanizadora, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en este nuevo proyecto. Es por eso que esta solicitando nueva mente su cooperación para esté préstamo y que su nuevo negocio se pueda realizar y así mismo darle empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Guillermo M. is very grateful for his previous loan which helped his business grow and allowed him to have the necessary tools. He wants to start a new car wash business at the same site as his tire repair shop. At present, however, he lacks the necessary funds to invest in this new project. This is the reason he is requesting new cooperation for this new loan so that he can set up his new shop and be able to employ others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for his shop.

loans.name: Felipe Israel

texts.es:
El señor Felipe Israel F. tiene ya más de quince años dedicándose al oficio de soldador. Este negocio y sus trabaja son los ingresos que tiene para dar lo mejor a su familia ya que tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta materia prima como es acero y otra soldadura más potente ya que tiene varios pedidos que entregar pero por falta de material no los ha tenido listo. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita y así entregar los pedidos a tiempo antes de que sus clientes busquen otra persona
que les elabore los figuras, que desean para adornar sus casas está navidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares los cubre con el sueldo de su empleo en una maquiladora.
texts.en:
For the last 15 years Felipe Israel F. has been a welder. His shop and his assignments produce income with which he attempts to provide a better life for his family; he has two small children. His shop lacks raw material like steel and a more poweful welding machine so he has several pending orders that he has not been able to fill due to the lack of materials. For this reason, he is requesting funds to buy the needed materials so that he can have orders ready on time thus avoiding losing his customers to others, who may produce their Christmas figures to decorate their homes. He plans to repay his loan with profits from the shop since he is able to cover household expenses with the salary he earns as an employee at an assembly plant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and a welding machine.
