payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blanca María

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Blanca María E. le está haciendo falta un cambiar el techo ya que el actual está en muy malas condiciones. Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para poder repararlo, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de construir el nuevo techo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo de su trabaja como enfermera de una institución gubernamental, ya que su esposo el señor Julio Cesar E. se encargara de los gastos familiares con su ingreso de su trabajo como jefe de departamento del seguro social de Nuevo Laredo. 
Desea tener la casa que le dejaron sus padres en buenas condiciones
texts.en:
Blanca María E.'s house needs a new roof since the current one is in very bad condition. Thus, she is requesting funds to repair it since she does not have the wherewithall to buy materials and pay the person who will install the new roof. She intends to repay the loan using the salary she earns as a nurse in a state institution since her husband, Julio Cesar E., will see to the household expenses with his salary earned as a department head at the Nuevo Laredo Social Security. She hopes to keep the house her parents left her in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace her wood roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que tiene 5 hijos, vive junto a su esposo y  sus dos últimos hijos de 18 y 12 años en casa de un familiar. Se ubica en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la confección de disfraces. Nos comenta que la idea nació cuando sus hijos estaban pequeños y empezaron a estudiar: ella confeccionaba sus disfraces por sí sola y los padres de sus compañeros de clase. Ellos le decían que estaban muy bonitos y luego le empezaron a pedir que confeccionara algunos para sus hijos. Desde ese entonces ha estado trabajando. Ahora se dedica a confeccionar nuevos disfraces en base a pedidos y a alquilar los que ya tiene guardados.

Durante el tiempo en que ha estado trabajando ha  invertido sus ganancias en la compra de más material. Por lo tanto ahora su pequeño taller está abarrotado de disfraces y no puede mostrarlos a sus clientes. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de vitrinas o mostradores. Los cuales harán que sus diseños tengan mejor vista. También piensa invertir en la compra de material para seguir confeccionando disfraces.

Ella es una mujer alegre, dinámica y trabajadora. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio. Enith es optimista y le gusta mucho su trabajo. Cada vez que diseña sus disfraces lo hace con la mayor pasíon y entrega posibles.
texts.en:
Enith is a 40 year old housewife who has 5 children. She lives with her husband and her two youngest children, ages 18 and 12, in a relative’s house. She lives in the city of Lambayeque, 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She is engaged in the making of costumes. She tells us that the idea was born when her children were small and began going to school: she used to make costumes on her own for her children and the parents of their classmates. The parents told her that they were very beautiful, and then they began to ask that she make some for their children. Ever since then she has been working. Now she is involved in making new costumes on the basis of orders and to rent out those that she keeps.

During the time she has been working, she has invested her profits in the purchase of more material. As a consequence, her little workshop is crammed with costumes, and she is not able to show them all to her customers. For this reason, she is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles that she plans to invest in the purchase of counters or display cases. This will mean that her designs will be more easily seen. She also plans to invest in material for continuing to make costumes.

She is a cheerful, dynamic, and hardworking woman. Her dream is to get ahead in her business. Enith is an optimist and likes her work a lot. Every time she designs a costume she makes it with the greatest passion and delivers the best possible product.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of material and showcases for her business

loans.name: Alain Alonso

texts.es:
Alaín tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y cuatro hermanos en el pueblo joven San Martín, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace tres años su madre adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) y se la entregó para que trabajara en ella. Durante todo este tiempo el ha estado trabajando en la mototaxi y con ella ha estado apoyando a su familia, asimismo también se ha pagado sus estudios de mecánica automotriz en un Instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que empiece a sufrir fallas y para repararlas es preciso comprarle nuevas piezas a su motor, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación de su vehículo y en la legalización de los papeles de propiedad y licencias necesarias para ganarse el sustento de forma segura.

Alaín desea seguir estudiando para asegurarse su futuro y seguir apoyando a su familia. El es un joven muy querido y estimado por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive.
texts.en:
Alaín is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents and four brothers in the town of San Matrín, located in the city of Lambayeque, 15 minutes from Chiclayo city.

Three years ago his mother bought a mototaxi (a motorized taxi vehicle used for transporting cargo and passengers) and gave it to him so he could use it to work. During this time he has been working with the mototaxi and with it has been able to support his family, as well as pay his auto mechanic studies in Chiclayo Institute.

The continuous use of his mobile unit has caused malfunctions and to repair it he needs to buy new parts for the engine. This is the reason he needs to request Edpyme Alternativa 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to repair his vehicle, to legalize his documents of ownership, and the necessary licenses to earn his living securely.

Alaín wishes to continue studying to secure his future and continue to support his family. He is a well-loved young man and appreciated by his neighbors in the area he lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad en el pueblo joven San Martín, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi alquilada (las mototaxis son vehículos motorizados utilizados en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). Antes trabajaba como cobrador en una combi que cubría la ruta Lambayeque – Chiclayo. Tuvo que dejar esta labor por que no le brindaba los recursos que necesitaba para seguir sustentando a su familia. 

De vez en cuando trabaja como estibador en el mercado de la ciudad. Estos ingresos son también un apoyo imporante a la economía de su familia. Además su esposa trabaja como empleada del hogar. Juntos se esfuerzan diariamente para seguir adelante y progresar.

El dueño del vehículo que maneja le está vendiendo la mototaxi. Por lo que Carlos quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para agenciarse de un medio seguro con el cual mantener a los suyos. Por este motivo el está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para pagar el importe de este vehículo y también para legalizar los documentos de propiedad y licencias que necesita para asegurarse un trabajo formal.

Su sueño es poder arreglar su casa que está construida rústicamente y reunir el capital necesario para instalar una bodega cuyos ingresos aseguren la educación superior de sus hijos. El es una persona estimada por sus vecinos que lo consideran un padre responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 37-year-old husband and father of tho children, 15 and 12, who live in the new town of San Martín, which is in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 5 years he has worked as a driver of a leased mototaxi. (Mototaxis are motorized, 3-wheel vehicles that are licensed for the transportation of passengers). He used to work as a fare collector on a minibus which operated on the Lambayeque-Chiclayo route. He had to leave this employment because it did not produce enough income to support his family. Occasionally he worked as a stevedore in the municipal market. This income is an important contribution to his family's economic stability. In addition, his wife works as a domestic employee in a private home. Together they struggle daily to get ahead and progress. The owner of the vehicle he leases is selling it. Carlos wants to take advantage of this situation which will afford him a stable income to care for his family. This is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to purchase this vehicle and to pay the fees to legalize the ownership transfer and to get the necessary licenses to insure formal work. His dream is to be able to improve his house which is currently built only in a very unfinished manner and to open a general store which will provide income which will insure his children's higher education. His neighbors think highly of him and consider him to be a responsible and hard-working father.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a used mototaxi.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan C. is from the village of Barra, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old and married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Allan owns and operates a business harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Allan has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately $173 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Allan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Allan is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his first loan from PMPC. He plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina C. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This  will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Melissa Yasmin

texts.es:
Melissa es madre soltera, tiene 29 años de edad y vive junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 10 años. Empezó a vender en los exteriores del mercado principal de la ciudad de Lambayeque y hace 8 años la reubicaron en un mercado cercano. Todos los días se traslada hacia el terminal pesquero de la región (ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa) para comprar la mercancía que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

La temporada de escasez de pescado que se está presentando en el litoral norte del país ha hecho que muchos de los pequeños negocios de venta de pescado de la región se vean afectados. No pueden adquirir la cantidad de mercadería que necesitan para mantenerse y el negocio de Melissa es uno de ellos. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más mercadería y así seguir sacando adelante su negocio.

Ella desea seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y de esa manera asegurarles un buen futuro. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita a nuestra institución y durante este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Melissa is a 29-year-old, single mother of two children, 13 and 10, who live in the city of Lambayeque, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold fish for the past 10 years. She began selling outside Lambayeque's main market and 8 years ago she was relocated to a nearby market. Every day she goes to the regional fishing terminal (located in the Santa Rosa district) to buy merchandise to offer her customers. This is the only source of family income. Fish has been scarce this season along the Northern coast of the country and this has affected many of the small fish selling businesses. They are unable to acquire the amounts of merchandise needed to stay in business and Melissa's has suffered this fate. This is why she has had the need to request 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more merchandise and thus continue to help her business stay afloat. She wants to continue working so that she can provide her children with a quality education and thereby assure them a good future. This is the fourth loan she has asked of our institution and during this time she has shown responsibility and punctuality in her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Marleni

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 23 años de edad y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío San Bernardino, distrito de Túcume, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es costurera y se dedica a esta labor desde hace tres años. Aprendió el oficio con una cuñada y empezó a trabajar con una máquina de coser de pedal. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos: sus clientes le solicitan el servicio y le brindan el material que necesita para realizar su trabajo.

La máquina con la que trabaja tiene muchos años de antiguedad y está empezando a sufrir fallas. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de otra máquina de coser semi industrial. Así puede seguir trabajando y apoyando al sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo es agricultor y juntos tratan se salir adelante y progresar.

Nancy planea instalar un pequeño taller en casa de sus padres para trabajar junto a sus hermanas que también son costureras; ella sueña con construir su casa propia y por ello trabaja todos los dias con ahínco.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada en la zona en donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una joven responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in her parents' house in the San Bernardino hamlet, Túcume district, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a seamstress for the past 3 years. She learned this trade from her sister-in-law and began working using a treadle sewing machine. She does piece work: her customers request the service and supply the material needed for the job. The machine she works with is very old and is beginning to fall apart. This is the reason she is requesting funds for the first time from Edpyme Alternative. She needs 1000 new soles to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine. Thus she can continue to work and help support her family. Her husband is a farmer and together they do their best to get ahead and progress. Nancy plans to install a small workshop in her parents' home so that she can work together with her sisters, who are also seamstresses. She dreams with building her own home and this is why she works daily with great earnestness. She is well-known and liked in the area in which she lives; her neighbors consider her to be a hard-working and responsible young lady.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a semi-industrial sewing machine to improve her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Colambutan Bajo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn to sell. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $150 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe M. es madre soltera de un hijo y una hija y juntos como una familia unida, luchan por salir adelante y obtener un  mejor futuro.
Ella tiene establecido 2 negocios uno de ellos es la elaboración y venta de tamales cada día sábado  y los vende en Estados Unidos y  el otro negocio es una vulcanizadota establecida desde hace 2 años. Ella esta solicitando un  crédito para la instalación de 2 techos de lamina de su vivienda en construcción.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe M. is a single mother of a son and daughter who together, as a family, struggle to get ahead and have a better future. She has two enterprises going: one is making tamales which she sells on Saturdays in the United States; the other is a tire repair shop which she has had for the past two years. She is requesting funds to install two metal roofs on her house which is under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a metal roof.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 41 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus cinco hijos en el sector Casablanca, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy joven y al comercio de animales desde hace tres años. Es propietario de 0.25 hectareas de terreno de cultivo y acostumbra a arrendar un terreno de igual área para sembrar maíz.

Además compra y cría animales menores (chivos, carneros, patos) para luego venderlos a vecinos que los comercializan en la ciudad de Chiclayo y en la frontera con Ecuador. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar con la que cuentan.

Hace poco cosechó el maíz que había sembrado pero descuidó su negocio de animales. Las pocas ganancias que obtuvo de la agricultura las piensa invertir en la nueva campaña de siembra, pero no puede seguir descuidando la principal fuente de ingreso familiar. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales para seguir criando y vendiendo.

Su mas grande anhelo es construir su casa de material noble. La suya esta construida de material rústico y la humedad de los sembríos vecinos está afectando la salud de sus hijos. El es un padre trabajador y siempre da lo mejor de sí para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Casablanca sector, Mórrope district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since he was very young and has sold animals for the past three years. He owns 0.25 hectares of arable land and he tends to lease a second plot of the same size to grow corn. In addition, he buys and raises small farm animals (goats, lambs, ducks) which he raises and then sells to neighbors who, in turn, sell them in the city of Chiclayo and on the border with Ecuador. This is the family's main source of income. A short time ago he harvested his corn crop but neglected the animal raising side of his business. The small profits he got from his crops he intends to reinvest in his next planting but he must not continue to neglect his main source of family income. For this reason, he has seen the need, for the first time, to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan. He is asking for 1000 new soles to buy animals to continue to raise them for sale. His greatest wish is to build a house of substantial materials. His is made of rustic materials and the dampness from the adjacent fields is affecting his children's health. He is a hard-working father who always gives his best to see his family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals to raise and sell.

location.town: Caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca - Morrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan G. is from the village of Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 52 years old and married and has five children. To make a living, Alan owns and operates a business selling gasoline and 2T oil (2-cycle or 2-stroke) and other lubricants in the local community. Alan is just starting this business.

In 2009, Alan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his first loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina C. is 47 years old and married to Vencensio C.. Both are residents of Purok-4 Pangabuan, Tangub City. They were blessed with nine children who are now either adults or of school age. Angelina is a vendor of “amahong” (a family of sea shells), while her husband is a fisherman. She earns an average net income of $100 a month in vending amahong. She has been dealing in amahong for twenty years.

As a good member of PAGLAUM MPC under the PDP-LP Program, she is given the privilege of being granted her third-cycle loan in the amount of P6,000.00. She is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She enjoyed the other products and services offered to all our members of PAGLAUM MPC.

The proceeds of this loan will be used to buy a boat pump machine to be used by her husband in fishing, and the rest of the proceeds will be used in supporting their daily needs and for the repayment of their loan.

loans.use: To buy a boat pump machine

loans.name: Jose Rodolfo

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 11 años en casa de su madre, ubicada en el sector La Hollería, distrito de Mórrope, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su profesión original es la alfarería, confecciona ollas y vasijas de barro en su casa a pedido de un intermediario que viene a recoger sus productos eventualmente. Hasta hace un año trabajaba en una empresa agroindustrial pero esta tuvo que recortar personal y fue despedido. Con el dinero de su liquidación instaló una pequeña bodega en su casa a iniciativa de su esposa y con este negocio se asegura una fuente de ingreso familiar estable.

Eventualmente también trabaja como obrero de construcción civil, pero este trabajo no es permanente así como su labor de alfarero. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería y ampliar su bodega.

El es un padre de familia honrado y trabajador, su sueño es ampliar su bodega y adquirir una camioneta para dedicarse a la distribución de bebidas en la zona ya que este producto es escaso en las bodegas del lugar.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old and lives with his wife and their 11-year-old son in the home of his mother, located in La Hollería, district of Mórrope, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. His original profession is pottery. He makes clay pots and vases at his home at the request of an intermediary who comes and picks up the products eventually. Until a year ago he was also working at an agribusiness, but it had to cut staff and he was fired. With his severance pay he set up a small convenience store in his home thanks to his wife's initiative, and this business assures them of a stable family income. Eventually he also found work as a civil construction worker, but it is not a permanent job like his pottery work. Because of all this he has seen the need to request his first loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350) through Kiva partner Edpyme Alternative, to use to purchase more merchandise and expand his store. He is an honest father and worker, and his dream is to expand his store and acquire a truck so he can make a living distributing drinks throughout his area since these products are in short supply at local stores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to expand his convenience store

location.town: Caserío La Holleria - C. P. M. El Romero - Morrope

Liney is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
“Great things are not achieved easily”, says Zenaida, a 51 year-old businesswoman who is known to be very patient and industrious with her business. She and her husband are separated and she has two children. Her youngest child is still studying in high school. She hopes to give a good future to her children through her business. She hopes to maintain it for the welfare of her children. 

Zenaida owns and operates a canteen located at the center of municipality along the high way. She has been ten years in her business and she is thankful knowing that the business is growing.  In meeting the growing needs of her store, she is asking for assistance from lenders. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP10,000 to help her in sustaining the demands of her customers. She hopes that her loan will be approved to further expand her business, thus provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nymrita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nymrita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nymrita from PMPC. To make a living, Elizabeth operates a snack-vending business, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
“The slow and steady wins the race," says Victoria as she believes that deliberateness and determination will lead to success. Victoria is 58 years old from the village of District 2, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is happily married to Degracias, a trailer operator in the farm. The couple is blessed with two children and their youngest child still attends school.  She hopes that through her business her youngest will finish her studies up to the highest level.

Victoria is engaged in managing a canteen located along the high way in the center of their municipality. She needs additional capital of PHP10,000 to buy more needed commodities for her canteen. She has been in business for 13 years already and she is grateful that her business is further expanding. She hopes to maintain her canteen to improve the general living condition of their family.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities for her canteen

loans.name: Nguyễn Đăng's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Đăng (10114010045) is a 41-year-old man who lives in Đông Anh - Hà Nội. T. is the leader of a 6-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Oai 1 (6).

T. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. operates a family member's livestock business, where he raises and sells cattle. T. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.876.000 VND from SEDA. He used the previous loan to buy calves to raise and sell in the future. He is now requesting a new loan of 5.886.000 VND that he will used to buy more calves. This will be T.'s 6th loan from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Nguyễn Đăng (10114010045) là 41 tuổi nam. Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Oai 1 (6). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.876.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.886.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị C. (10114010046) là 36 tuổi nữ. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 4. Trương Thị P. (10114010033) là 37 tuổi nữ. loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel A. is 43 years old, married to Mr. Reno, 47 years old. The couple is blessed with two children, namely: Sarina Daphnie, grade II pupil and Luis Daryll, grade I pupil. Azel is operates her business two years from now. 

She is engaged in the buy and sell business of clothes, at the same time she sells AVON products and owns a retail store. She buys clothes in Manila (which is around 6 hours travel from her village) then she will sell these in their village. She sells it through walking around their village looking for costumers who will buy clothes.

Azel is dreaming of improving her business. She wants to have a permanent location for her business by setting aside some of her business earnings. She wanted to borrow the amount of PHP7,000 for additional capital of her business. She planned to buy a bigger bulk of clothes from Manila to maximize her transportation costs.

loans.use: Additional capital for her small businesses

She is 33 years old and she has been six years in her business. They blessed with five children with her husband named Edgardo D. L.. He is 35 years old and a carpenter.

texts.en:
Daisy dreams to have a successful and productive business. She has been selling vegetables at Cauayan Public Market for almost ten years now and her weekly net income is PHP500.00. She wanted to request a loan amount of PHP10,000.00, to purchase additional merchandise for her business.  

She is married to a farmer named Mauro G.. The couple is blessed with eight children, the eldest is only 17 years old, and the youngest is three months old. They are harmoniously residing at the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is in front of the village hall. She wants to live a simple life even though the family sometimes has make ends meet due to inadequate budget. According to her, money is not so much important in our life, all they need is peace in their hearts.

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Esmerenciana

texts.en:
Esmerenciana or "Esme", as she is fondly called, is 50 years old. She manages a typical retail store in their village for almost a year and her weekly net income is PHP1,000.00. Her husband Teodoro helps her to earn money by driving a motorized tricycle in their town.  He earns a daily net income ranging from PHP500  to PHP600.  She wanted to apply for  a loan of PHP17,000 from the KIVA lenders that she will use to purchase more merchandise for her store and also for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. 

The couple is blessed with six children, they are; Viggie Gil,27, undergraduate in College, followed by Randy,25, undergraduate in high school, Teodoro Jr., 20, high school level, Brylle Jann,high school level,19 years old, next to him is her sister Sarah Mae,18, first year college student, and their youngest is Charlene,12, grade 6 student. They lived at the village of Alinam, Cauayan City.  Most of the people earn their living through farming. She believes in the motto, "It's better to give than to receive".

loans.use: Additional commodities in her retail store and for the repair of motorcycle used in the business by her husband

loans.name: Norwina

texts.en:
"Achieving success in life is quite difficult because one has to go on through many challenges in life," said by Norwina C.. She is young  and has strong determination businesswoman. She is married to Francisco C. who is a tricycle driver within the village of Calao East, Santiago City. 

Norwina is selling street foods and frozen foods for nine years. According to her, improving her business is what she wanted to be able to sustain the needs of her family. They are blessed with three children: Cleo-10 years old who is Grade-V pupil; Dave-6 years old who is Grade-I pupil and the youngest is Melaisah-3 years old. Norwina would like to ask for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders amounting PHP35,000. She hopes that she could avail of this amount she is requesting for her business improvement.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending activity

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 31 years old and married to Pedrito.  They are blessed with a son, who is now four years old and studying in a day care center. They are presently residing at the village of Sillawit, Cauayan City, a rural area.
 
She manages a fish vending business in their village and she earns a weekly net income is PHP800.00.  She wanted to increase her  income for the schooling of their son. She desires to request a loan amount of PHP5,000.00 for her additional working capital and wants to build a productive business. She hopes that KIVA will grant her loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: Additional capital in her fish vending business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
First thing that comes in her mind when she thinks of her business is "responsibility". Editha is already 40 years old and she operates a retail store in their village for almost five years. She is married to Virgilio, who works as a tricycle driver in their town for almost 15 years. Her weekly net income is PHP500.00, and her husband is PHP300.00 daily.  She wanted to help her husband to earn an income, but they lack capital.  She then decided to avail a loan amount of PHP5,000.00 to purchase some grocery items and the excess is for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. Their major source of income is farming where they harvest rice twice a year earning them a net income of PHP5,000.00.  

They are blessed with three children: Cherry,16 years old,  first year college student; Sheila Mae, 11 years old, grade 6 student, and their youngest is Ravier, 1 year old. They are harmoniously residing at the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. Their house is located at the back of a day-care center. Editha said that her inspiration in her daily endeavors are her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store and for the maintenance of their motorcycle

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a street food vendor in the village of Calao East, Santiago City. She is 36 years old and married. The couple is blessed with four children: Marlon-16 years old high school student; Maria Jean-12 years old; Maricel-10 years old elementary pupil and Alimar-2 years old.

Aileen would like to improve and buy additional street foods to be sold within their village so that she could provide the needs of her family. According to her, the income she generated from her business is not enough that’s why she would like to request additional capital amounting PHP5,000. This amount will be of great help in her business and family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending business

loans.name: Sosima

texts.en:
Sosima is 35 years of age and married to Fernando. They are blessed with four children: Mark John-14 years old high school student;Jeffrey-12 years old high school; Jefferson-12 years old elementary pupil and Jasmine-3 years old.

Sosima is selling a variety of  goods such as ponytails,cuticle remover and threads in their village.  She would like to borrow additional capital amounting PHP5,000. This amount she is requesting will be utilized in purchasing additional goods for her vending activity. She hopes that she could obtain the amount of loan she is asking so that she could further improve their way of living through her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

loans.name: Jaru

texts.en: Jaru J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Jaru is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts and make paste to sell

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina A., 43 years old, grows rice for a living. She has seven children. Her eldest child is 23 and still living with her. Aquilina works from 6 AM to 3 PM to ensure an abundant harvest. She would like to ask for a second loan from Community Economic Ventures. She plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to ensure her crop are healthy. 

Aquilina likes the CEVI services because aside from it’s helping a great number of people, it has only 2% interest rate, which is very affordable and easy to repay.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
“Sacrifice and humility are necessary in achieving success in life,” says Janet B.. Janet is married to Eric, a tricycle driver. This couple is blessed with three children: Erica-ten years old,grade-V pupil;Angelica-eight,grade-II pupil and Linette-four years old. 

Janet is selling snacks and frozen foods in their village.  Her husband sometimes helps her in her business. She would like to purchase additional snacks and frozen foods for her to generate bigger income for her family needs. In this regard, she would like to apply a loan amounting PHP5,000 for her business improvement. She hopes that she could avail this amount so that she could be able to budget it wisely.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending activity

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. is a 46-year old farmer, from Bunawan, Agusan del Sur.  She grows rice for a living. She has been doing her very best she can  to support her family. She has been a CEVI client for a quite long time now. She maintains a good performance by conscientiously repaying her loan on time. 

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy seeds and farming necessities. She requires this loan as she doesn’t have sufficient funds to continue supporting her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing; to buy seeds and farming necessities

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina M. is currently in the business of selling fresh fried fish on the street during evening hours. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies of tomatoes and onions to sell.  Sabina is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. Sabina has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita D., 38 years old, is engaged into rice farming. She has six children. Her eldest child is 18 years old. She wants to make her business prosper so that she will be able to support the growing needs in their family. Marianita also wants to send all of her children to school. Her family relies totally on the income from their farm. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying all the farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.en:
Maria Monica, fondly named “ Bing”, is 33 years old and still single. She lives happily with her parents at Brgy. Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. With the help of her parents, she finished a vocational course particularly Home Technology. She aimed to uplift their status of living so she can prepare her future and provide for her parents who are now growing old.

Due to scarcity of job opportunities, she put up a small eatery in their village selling cooked food and snacks. Since she has small capital she can only earn a net income of PHP600.00 a week which they used to meet their daily basic needs and save some for their future. She aimed to improve her small eatery and she wants to borrow additional capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP6,000.00.  This will used in the improvement of her business. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can able to improve her small business and increase her income. As she have said, “ A person with faith and determination will reach his ambition."

loans.use: Additional capital for her small eatery business

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara P. lives in Ljevan with her husband and daughter. Since 1992 Tamara has manage her own café. Tamara’s husband is a musician. He doesn't work regular hours so he helps his wife with her large business. At the beginning Tamara had a small café, but during the past 17 years she has reinvested the income from her business and was able to buy the neighboring land to enlarge her café. With the income from her business Tamara is able to supports her family, to reconstruct her café, to buy café equipment and a car to use for café needs. Tamara’s café is very popular in Ljevan thanks to its cleanness and good service. Tamara needs a loan of $3,000 to buy a projector and screen for her café which will enable her to show music videos and thus attract young clientele. With future income, Tamara hopes to increase the café’s size and make it more comfortable in winter months.

loans.use: To buy a projector and screen for her café

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda A., 58, is a rice farmer. She has six children. Her eldest child is 34 years old and married, and is also a farmer. Florenda would like to make her business prosper. Now, she is relying on the income she makes on her farm.

She needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy seeds and other farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish L., 22, is a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has one child who is two years old. She said that the she was able to benefit a lot from the loan she obtained from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) because it helped her sustain her livelihood. 

She would like to request a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying all the farming necessities. Charish likes the services of CEVI because, according to her, it helps a lot of people and has a very low interest rate of 2% a month.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Apio

texts.en:
Apio M. is currently in the business of selling beer and local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. Apio is 30 years old and is married to a teacher. She has six children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a furniture shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano T., 49, has been married for 18 years is is a rice farmer. He has two children. His eldest child is 17 years old and still lives with them. His family is relying on the size of harvest the farm will produce. He is doing the very best he can to be able to provide his family with better living conditions. 

He needs additional capital to run and manage his business. He would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to grow his business by buying farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married to Crisanto, 52 years old and a  farmer. They blessed with one child named Christia, a high school student. Crisanto is busy in their farm; while Lita is engaged in retailing business of goods in their village of Matusalem, Aurora, Isabela. She started her business since the time her daughter started going to school. Her business, since then has helped her in providing funds for her child in school.

Lita lives happily and peacefully with her family. She is dreaming that someday her child will finish her schooling. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP8,000 for additional capital of her business. She wanted to improve her business for her family’s future, especially for her child.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the village of Mobod. She is 25 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Jocelyn raises pigs for sale. Jocelyn has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
M. Aisha is the leader of her lending group in Ganyana. The group is located on the Busabala landing site near Lake Victoria. Aisha is a hard-working and devoted lady. She has been a farmer and fishmonger in Ganyana for such a long time. Ever since she joined her lending group, life has been a bit more fair and she has been able to educate her children and acquire household items for her family's development. 

Aisha grows bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes on her farm. She also fishes, and she sells fresh and dried fish to her customers at the landing site. She needs a loan to buy more fish to resell, and to employ laborers on her farm to increase her productivity.

loans.use: To buy fish to resell and to hire laborers for her farm

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta G., owns and manages a small corn farm in her village. She is 38 years old and has been married for 12 years. She has three children. Her eldest child is 10 years old. She has been doing her best to prosper in her her livelihood in order to help pay the tuition, books and other school fees. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use her loan to buy all the farming necessities to grow her crops.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married to Marife and they are blessed with a child named Kimberly, who is two years old. Julius believes that “If there is sacrifice there is progress” and he takes this as his guiding principle in life. Julius and his wife have great ambition for their daughter – they want her to be successful in her chosen profession so that she will be able to take care of them when they are old.

Despite the economic crisis, the couple have a strong determination to improve their standard of living and give their daughter a better future. In this regard, Julius manages their jeepney to earn income while his wife manages a small eatery in their village. Their average monthly income is 6,000 PHP, which they use to meet their basic daily needs and save for their daughter's future. They aim to increase their income so they can save more. Therefore, Julius is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to be used to maintain his vehicle and improve his wife's business.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle, and improve his wife's eatery business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is 48 years old and has been planting rice since she had a family. She has nine children, the eldest of whom is 27. Her husband is a farmer, and they work together every day to grow rice to generate a regular income to meet their family's needs. She says that her farm is becoming more productive due to Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). A previous loan from CEVI has helped a great deal in buying all the farming necessities to have an abundant harvest.

Elvira would like to request a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She appreciates CEVI's services because the loans have a very low interest rate (2% a month), which makes them affordable to repay.

loans.use: To finance her farm

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku R. is currently in the business of designing and selling bedsheets. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bedsheets to design and sell.  Kaku is 18 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs in terms of the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bedsheets to design and sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is from the village of Manticao in Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teresita makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Teresita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make the food that she sells

loans.name: Rowna Group

texts.en:
Rowna is the group leader of the Rowna Group. There are four members in this group, each of whom wants a loan to expand and enlarge her business. They are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani.

Rowna wants a loan for her embroidery business. She'll use the money to buy all of the materials that she needs for her business. Bibi Gul wants a loan for her husband's bakery so he can buy the materials that he needs. Fatama wants a loan to buy supplies for her tailoring business. She has many clients who like the way that she works, so her monthly income increases day by day. Leela wants a loan for her husband's veil shop. 

They all very happy about the availability of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Christie Ellen

texts.en:
Christie Ellen A. is a 26-year-old corn farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has four children. Her eldest child is only 8 years old. She likes being a farmer because she is able to eat fresh food coming from her farm. She said she needs additional capital for her business to buy farming necessities; that is why she has requested a loan of  10,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. 

She will use the loan to grow her harvest so that she could be able to buy the basic needs for their family. She said she likes CEVI services a lot because its program is helping a lot of people start a new business. She is delighted with CEVI's 2% interest rate because it is very low and affordable to repay.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle hopes to improve her business in order to provide the needs of her children in terms of education. She is engaged in the retailing business, selling fish, vegetables and meat. She wanted to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders amounting to 6,000 Pjilippine pesos. She is also hoping that her loan request will be granted.  

She is from the village of Matusalem, San Manuel, Isabela. She is 44 years old and has four children. Anabelle is married to Roberto, 47.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Jocebel

texts.en:
Jocebel A., 36 years old, is a farmer in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She has seven children. Her eldest child is only 15. She works very hard from morning to sunset to maintain her farm and plant crops beside her rice farm. She says the farm would be better managed if there were enough funds to cover all the farming expenses. That is why she joined the credit program initiated by Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Now, she would like to apply again for a loan of 12,000 PHP. Receiving this loan will go far in improving her harvest.

She joined in CEVI in 2008. She has stayed in the program for quite a long time now because she likes the services offered by CEVI, and it has only a 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Puru

texts.en:
Puru N. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials such as yeast and sugar. Puru is 35 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase brewing materials such as yeast and sugar

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary A. is a 53-year-old rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan del Sur, Mindanao. He owns and tills a 1-hectare farm. His family is totally dependent on the income he makes growing rice. The farm really provides his family adequate food and clothing and meets their other basic needs. He was also able to buy a farm. He is utilizing his newly bought farm to be able to supplement the family income. He never minds working under the heat of the sun every day. What he is mindful about is providing his family with better living conditions.

He requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy farming necessities to grow his rice crops well and have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married to Manuel, who is 58 years old and a driver of dump trucks with the DPWH (Department of Public Works and Highway). They were blessed with four children. Since the salary of her husband is not enough to meet their needs, she decided to engage in the business of direct selling Avon products in their village.

Leticia wanted to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP as additional capital for her business to increase her merchandise, and so her income. She is hoping that the lenders will give her the chance to make her business grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca M. is managing a rice farm in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, Mindanao. Rice is a basic commodity in their location. People there are buying rice. That is why she decided to grow rice on her farm. She has six children. Her eldest child is 22 years old. She dreams that someday she will be able to save money to support their college education.

She says she was about to give up planting rice. But, because it is helping her family a lot, she continues to grow rice for a living. She would like to request a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will be put into buying all the farming necessities for an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell.  Gai is 23 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
With their interest in improving their standard of living, Tessie and her husband, Arthur, help each other to earn a living and support the schooling of their four children. They live in a rural place located in Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They believe that they can send their children to school through hard work and sacrifice. Farming is their common source of income. They plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Aside from this, Tessie put up a small sari-sari (variety) store in front of their house to earn additional income while waiting for harvest time. Since she has only a small amount of capital, she can earn a net income of only $12 a week, which she uses to acquire their daily basic needs and to finance the needs of their children.

In this regard, Tessie wants to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP14,000.00, to be used in acquiring additional items for her sari-sari store. She believes that through hard work, they can improve their living conditions and give their children a better future.

loans.use: Additional capital for the improvement of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza P., who is 38 years old, is a rice farmer. She owns a 1-hectare farm that she hopes will provide her family enough income to buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. She has three children. Her eldest is only 14. She wishes that someday she could buy more farms so as to be able to support all the family's needs.  

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities to grow her rice to harvest. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks, who charge high interest rates.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 38 years old. Her husband's name is Manuel, and they have three children: Niño Gabriel, 17 and a high school graduate; Manilyn, 11 and in elementary school; and Mary Joy, 1 year old. Myrna makes handicrafts which she sells in their village. She makes flowers made of newspaper. Aside from vending flowers, she also offers massages, since she is a graduate of reflexology. Her husband is in full support of her business.

Myrna would like to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP7000 to be used for business improvement. She would be thankful if this amount could be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L., who is 48 years old, is a pig grower. She has eight children. Her 27-year-old eldest child was not able to go to college because they cannot afford the tuition. She decided to start her small piggery. In that way, she will be able to have her other children attend college schools.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from the Kiva Field Partner, Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and hog feed supplements.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin J. is in the business of selling local alcohol from home and is requesting a loan to purchase more firewood for continuous distillation.  Martin is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a director. She has eight children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more firewood for continuous distillation

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en: Artyom K. is 33 years old. He lives in the village of Urtsadzor, in the Ararat region. He is married and has two children. Artyom and his wife are engaged in farm work, and at the same time they manage their own shop, where they sell food, household goods and toys. Artyom is asking for a $2300 loan to buy candy, non-alcoholic drinks, toys and saucepans for his shop, and to buy fodder for his sheep and cows.

loans.use: To buy goods for his shop and to buy fodder for his livestock

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna E., who is 46 years old, is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till a 1-½ hectare farm to raise money for all the family's needs.  She has only one child. Erna is doing the best she can to be a good mother and a good wife. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Erna will use the loan to buy farming necessities for their farm. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks, who charge high interest rates.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Erla

texts.en:
Erla T., who is 39 years old, is a rice farmer. She has five children. Her eldest child is only 17. She is doing the best she can to be able to save money to pay for the college education of her children. Farming is their only livelihood. The income she makes now from rice farming is what helps her family buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying additional necessities and seeds.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita sees herself as a successful mother with five children, who represent the result of the love between herself and her husband, Mr. Wilfredo L.. At the age of 55 she knows well her duties and responsibilities in her family. She has successfully sent her children to school and all are finished with their studies. Teresita says that the sacrifices and difficulties that she and her husband have survived bring tears, and that brings them closer together. Tears bring joy to them, because they see that their children have their own good futures. Teresita's husband is a farmer. The farm provided for their children's expenditures during their time in school. At present Teresita is engaged in a business of retailing goods in their village. She wants to improve her business because she is willing to help her grandchildren by giving them an allowance to go to school.

She is requesting the amount of PHP7,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety)store.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Daniel Gitau

texts.en:
Daniel is married to Alice and they have three children: Samuel, age 11; Kevin, age 9; and Maryanne, age 4. Daniel was introduced to the Kiva partner, Kadet, through an existing Kadet client. He is applying for his first loan with Kadet. 

Daniel has been operating a computer internet cafe business for the past six years. He wants to purchase additional electronics, because they are in demand. He also farms as another source of income.

He hopes to expand his current business and open another branch somewhere else with the extra profit generated from his current business. His dream is to provide others with employment and to improve the living conditions of his family. Daniel describes himself as a focused man and a very ambitious businessman.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase stock for his computer internet cafe business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income of Letecia L.. She is 70 years old, living in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with five children. She manages a one hectare rice field. She needs financial assistance to sustain her farm. She has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because of its low interest charge for financing. She's requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: agricultural financing

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico is a hog raiser. He hopes that there will be continuous growth in his new business to help his wife in providing for the needs of their children. Monico would like to access a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 6,000. He plans to purchase a supply of feed for his hogs. As he stated, he will try his best to expand his business with the assistance of KIVA lenders.

Monico is 49 years old and resides in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. He is married to Julieta and blessed with four school-aged children. Despite life difficulties, the couple hopes that their children will finish at least their secondary schooling.

loans.use: to buy a supply of feed for his hogs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. has a rice farming business in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Her rice field is about 2 hectares. She is 56 years old with 8 children; her eldest is 32 years old. She started this business back in1976.

Now she has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., requesting a loan of Php 15,000. She will use it to pay the hand tractor in her farm and provide inputs for the land. It will help her a lot not to borrow money from a rice trader who charges a lot of interest.

loans.use: agricultural financing

loans.name: Labeny

texts.en:
Labeny A. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Labeny is 27 years old and is widowed. She has 5 children, and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en: Jo-an H., 24, is the mother of a 3-year-old child. Her family lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, and has a hog raising business. She started this business in 2004. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to ask for financial assistance to help make her business grow. She's requesting a loan amount of 6,000 PHP to buy feed.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Muhammad Usaeen Group

texts.en:
This is the Muhammad Usaeen Group. This three-member group is requesting a group loan of 42000 Afghani. 

Muhammad Usaeen is the group leader. He is a 45-year-old married man. He has  5 children, three sons and two daughters. He runs a general store and his oldest son, who is 17 years old, helps him with his store. 

Seema, who is the second member, wants a loan for her husband, who has fresh fruit shop. The income from the shop supports their family. She wants a loan so that her husband can expand his business.

The last member is Aziza, who is a tailor. Since the Taliban regime, she has been sewing clothes, because they have had many economic problems. Now, she wants to use her Kiva loan to buy a new sewing machine and to start a sewing business so she can support her husband and children. 

They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Besides operating a motorcycle transport business, Stephen has a secondary source of income selling second-hand clothing, a business that is run by his wife.  He is 26 years old and married to Peninah Wangari.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He used the first loan to buy his motorcycle which he uses for a taxi transport business and he paid the loan well.  e will use this loan to purchase second-hand clothing to sell. 

One day, Stephen hopes to buy a piece of land where he will build rental houses.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L. manages a rice farming business in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has six children, and her eldest is 23 years old. She receives good income from her farm except when it is attacked by pests.

She needs additional capital to help sustain her rice field. She's now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to purchase farm supplies and to make payment for land preparation. This will help her to finance her business with a low interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 38 years old and a mother to two children.  She is married to Raul who is engaged in selling fishballs (a popular snack food made of fish and flour paste molded into balls and deep-fried before serving) and doing some carpentry jobs.  Anabelle helps her husband in selling fishballs.  She helps her husband in finding source of income for their family. At times, when she has extra time she would offer housekeeping service or work as a part-time saleslady for additional income of the family.
