She sells melons, pawpaw, oranges, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, garlic and other fruits and vegetables. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy onions and a scale. 

Her dream is to travel through East Africa and become a wholesale supplier. She describes herself as hardworking, responsible, and dependable. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy onions and a scale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old single mother of three children who has run a grocery store for the last eight years. Her business is strategically located next to a busy bus stage (station). She has a frequent overflow of customers and is able to employ one person. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase onions and potatoes. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to purchase a vehicle for her business and a plot of land on which to build. She describes herself as hardworking and says that she loves her work.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: E. Yolande est née le 03/08/1964 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Yolande est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Yolande qui assure les charges de la famille. Ainsi, Yolande utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Yolande vend des tissus, des chaussures et des bols en série. Yolande vend ses produits dans ses boutiques à son domicile et à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Yolande achète ses produits. Yolande est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yolande a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Yolande veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Yolande sollicite ce quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
E. Yolande was born on August 3, 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to GONDJOU Cyrille. The couple has two children who are both in school. The family has been living in Sègbèya in Cotonou for eleven years. Yolande’s husband is the one who ensures that family expenses are covered. Thus, Yolande uses her revenues to develop her business further. Basically, Yolande sells cloth, shoes, and nested bowls. She does so in her shops located in her home and in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country neighboring Benin, is where she purchases her goods. Yolande is a former ALIDé client who indeed repays her loans. She has already had three ALIDé loans for her business account. During this year-end holiday season, she wants to bolster her working capital for responding to customer demands. This is why she’s requesting this fourth ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, and bowls

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en: Shovkat is a mother of four children. She lives in Fuzuli region. She has been in the farming business for four years. She was born in 1965. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: E. Yolande est née le 03/08/1964 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Yolande est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Yolande qui assure les charges de la famille. Ainsi, Yolande utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Yolande vend des tissus, des chaussures et des bols en série. Yolande vend ses produits dans ses boutiques à son domicile et à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Yolande achète ses produits. Yolande est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yolande a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Yolande veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Yolande sollicite ce quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
E. Yolande est née le 03/08/1964 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Yolande est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Yolande qui assure les charges de la famille. Ainsi, Yolande utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Yolande vend des tissus, des chaussures et des bols en série. Yolande vend ses produits dans ses boutiques à son domicile et à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Yolande achète ses produits. Yolande est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yolande a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Yolande veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Yolande sollicite ce quatrième prêt de ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de tissus, de chaussures et de bols en série.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро Шарипова проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в местной щколе. Сама Зухро имеет среднее образование. Она более 15 лет занимается животноводством, откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Zuhro S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works at a local school. Zuhro has secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. She raises and sells livestock. Zuhro is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Djavanshir

texts.en: Djavanshir was born in 1983. He is single and lives in Fuzuli region. Three years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the things he needs for his beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy things needed for his beauty salon

loans.name: Naomi Wambui

texts.en:
Naomi Wambui is 62 years old. She is married and has four children. She is currently in the livestock business; she owns three cows. With this loan, Naomi Wambui will diversify her income by expanding into the grocery business. She will use this loan to purchase various items to sell (tomatoes, potatoes, charcoal, and carrots) as well as construction materials to build a small kiosk to use as her store.

Naomi Wambui is not completely new to micro-credit. She had taken a loan of 5,000 Kenya Shillings from another MFI, but there was an issue of fraud on the credit officer's part and she decided to try another loan with a different organization. Her friend introduced her to KADET, and this will be her first loan with KADET.

Naomi Wambui lives in a very low-income area, where squatters (homeless people) have been given some small plots of land to live. 

One day, Naomi Wambui hopes to have a business that will sufficiently meet her needs.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To start a grocery kiosk to sell tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, and charcoal

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: D. Pauline est née le 28 Décembre 1971 à Comè, dans le Département du Mono. Pauline est mariée à AGBOTON Paul, un photographe. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Kowégbo à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. C'est le mari de Pauline qui assure les charges de la famille. Pauline utilise alors les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Pauline vend des divers (boîtes de tomate, lait, sucre, sardines; des pâtes alimentaires; des biscuits, des savons; de l'huile végétale; etc.). C'est devant son domicile que Pauline vend ses produits. Mais Pauline fait ses achats à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pauline a eu déjà un crédit de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé. Aujourd'hui, Pauline sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Pauline was born on December 28, 1971 in Comè, in Mono County. She is married to AGBOTON Paul, a photographer. The couple has five children who are all in school. The family lives in Kowégbo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Pauline’s husband is the one who ensures that family expenses are covered. So Pauline uses her revenues for developing her business further. Basically, she sells a variety of goods (canned tomatoes, milk, sugar, sardine, pasta, cookies, soap, vegetable oil, etc.) She does so in front of her home. She purchases her goods in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Pauline has had an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid. Today, she’s requesting this second loan to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned tomatoes, milk, sugar, sardine, pasta, cookies, soap, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Komilchon

texts.ru: Комилчон Муродов проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Комилчон имеет магазин в котором, занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 13 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараборота.
texts.en:
Komilchon M. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Komilchon has a retail store where he primarily sells food products. He has been involved in this type of business for over 13 years. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Mrs. Anastacia A. is from the town of D'Ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and blessed with four school-aged children. She has been engaged in her business for more than six years, earning 8,000.00 per month from her business particularly the corn production endeavor. In 2000, she joined PMPC to gain access to their programs and services. Currently, she's availing her second cycle loan in the amount of 30,000.00 which will be used for additional capital for her existing project (corn production) and for the purchase of fertilizer and labor expenses.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for purchasing fertilizers for her corn production and labor expenses

loans.name: Michael Otieno

texts.en:
Michael Otieno is 40 years old and married with six children. He owns a tailoring business, where he sells mostly dresses. Michael Otieno has expanded his business over the years and employs other individuals in his shop. He is on his third loan cycle with KADET and will use this loan to purchase more fabric and to pay school fees for his children. 

Michael Otieno operates his business in an urban slum area. Most of his clients are very low-income earners. 

One day, he hopes to venture into the real estate business. He has already acquired a plot of land, but currently lacks the capital to develop it.



About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase fabric for his business and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Файзалиева Фируза проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст  43 года. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Она более 11 лет занимается торговлей в собственном магазине. Она торгует продуктами питания. На полученную прибыль хочет сыграть свадьбу дочери. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоброта.
texts.en:
Firuza F. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 43 years old, divorced and has 2 children. She has been involved in retails sales at her own store for over 11 years. She sells food products. Using the resulting profit, she wants to organize a wedding for her daughter. Firuza is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is a Palestinian man living in Gaza city. He is married with one child, 14 years old, who is in ninth grade.

Rafiq has had a grocery store since 2005 and the store is the main source of income for his family. In addition to that, he is an employee in the PNA (Palestinian National Authority). He started this store to help him to cover his family’s expenses as his salary is not enough.

Rafiq needs this loan to buy new products, since buying in larger quantities will save him a lot of money. He appears in the photo at his store

loans.use: To buy new products for his grocery store

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin has been in the auto repair business for five years. He is married and has one child. Elchin was born in 1976. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his auto repair business. He lives in Fuzuli region.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rasuldjon

texts.ru: Расулджон Джураев проживает в Бохтарском районе. Возраст 56 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Расулджон по специальности "сантехником" работает более 20 лет. Помимо этого он более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки скота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Rasuldjon D. lives in the Bohtar district. He is 56 years old, married and has 5 children. Rasuldjon has been working as a plumber for over 20 years. Besides this, he has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. He raises and sells livestock. Rasuldjon is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock. He wants to use the resulting profit to repair his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Peter Macharia

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and has been in the butchery business for two years. His butcher shop is his main source of income, from which he earns around 10,000 Kenya Shillings a month. Peter's other source of income comes from farming, from which he earns approximately 5,000 Kenya Shillings a month. 

This is Peter's first loan, and he will use it to renovate his butcher shop. He wants to repair the cracked, uneven floor and build a proper enclosure for the meat he sells. Peter's clients live in a very low income settlement.

One day, Peter hopes to buy live animals to slaughter and sell to retailers.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To renovate his butchery shop

loans.name: Djibiline

texts.fr: D. Djibiline est née en 1970 à Bassila dans le Département de la Donga. Djibiline est mariée à ADAM Abasse, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis douze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Djibiline qui assure les dépenses de la famille. Djibiline utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Djibiline vend de façon ambulante des savons de toilette fabriqués au Ghana, pays voisin du Bénin. C'est au Ghana que Djibiline achète ses produits. Djibiline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Djibiline sollicite ce crédit-ci pour augmenter la quantité de son stock de savons.
texts.en:
D. Djibiline was born in 1970 in Bassila in Donga County. She is married to ADAM Abasse, a chauffeur. The couple has five children who are all in school. The family has been living for a dozen years in Sègbèya in Cotonou. Djibiline’s husband is the one ensuring that family expenses are covered. Djibiline uses her revenues to develop her business further. Essentially, she goes door-to-door selling bath soaps made in Ghana, a country near Benin. Ghana is where she purchases her goods. Djibiline is a former ALIDé client who repays her loans. She’s requesting this loan to increase the quantity of soaps in her inventory.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en:
Libertad is 82 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Libertad receives a monthly pension of 6,800 and operates a cocoland receiving a monthly income of 2,000 per month. She is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Libertad is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase materials for her housing activity. This will be Libertad's first loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for  housing purposes

loans.name: Menglikul

texts.ru: Алибаев Менгликул проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Менгликул более 10 лет занимается откармливанием и продажей скота, т.е. животноводством. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Menglikul A. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. Menglikul has been involved in raising and selling livestock, i.e. animal husbandry, for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lydia Murangi

texts.en:
Lydia is 40 years old, married and has two children. Five years ago, Mary decided to start a business to put her children through school. She started by purchasing a kerosene pump. She grew her business and until she had three kerosene pumps. Lydia decided to sell that business and took out a loan to purchase a building. Lydia's building has 35 rooms which she rents out to families in a very low income area. 

This is Lydia's third loan with KADET. She used her previous loan to paint the building and install running water. With this loan, Lydia will purchase electricity meters for her tenants so that they can regulate their own electric consumption. 

In the future, Lydia hopes to expand her business and enter into the business of renting higher value rental homes.


”About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase electricity meters for her tenants so they can regulate their own electric consumption

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: A. Monique est née le 22 Septembre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis dix huit ans que Monique vit dans le quartier Sodjéatinmè à Cotonou. Monique est mariée à KOUTON Zachari, un soudeur, et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Monique n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis onze ans, et pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Monique vend des produits divers (boîtes de tomate, lait, sardine, petit pois, mayonnaise, pâte alimentaires, savons, bombons, biscuits, farine de maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Monique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits dans l'institution. Monique sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle
texts.en:
A. Monique was born on September 22, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For 18 years, she has been living in the Sodjéatinmè district in Cotonou. She is married to KOUTON Zachari, a welder, and is the mother of three children who are all in school. The couple jointly covers family expenses. Monique has never attended school. For eleven years, to help her husband with the family expenses, she has sold a variety of goods (canned tomatoes, milk, sardines, peas, mayonnaise, pasta, soap, candy, cookies, cornmeal, etc.). She does so at her home. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She is a former ALIDé client who has already benefited from three ALIDé loans. She’s requesting another ALIDé loan for bolstering her business and for satisfying her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (packets of sugar, boxes of condensed milk, detergents)

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru: Мехриниссо Назарова проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж занимается земледелием. Сама же Мехриниссо более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует национальной женской обувью. Дочь помогает иногда, торгует на рынке. Кредит просит для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mehrinisso N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband is involved in agriculture. And Mehrinisso has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 5 years. She primarily sells traditional women's shoes. Her daughter sometimes helps her sell at the market. Mehrinisso is requesting a loan in order to increase merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise selection

loans.name: Nicholas Ngula

texts.en:
Nicholas is 40 years old, married and has two children. He has been in the carpentry business for 15 years. He is on his 5th loan from KADET, and has used his previous loans to diversify his sources of income. Recently, he expanded into the bread and milk supply business. Catherine, Nicholas' wife, runs a grocery kiosk.

Nicholas is the Chairman of his borrower group. Nicholas will use this loan to purchase carpentry machinery for his shop. He employs a few workers. With the profits from this loan, Nicholas will become a meat distributer. He will purchase a cow at wholesale and then distribute the various meat sections to retail butchers.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase carpentry machinery for his carpentry and welding shop

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Тариев Акрам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст  28 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Акрам имеет среднее образование. Он более 3 лет занимается торговлей зерновыми продуктами на рынке. Жена, домохозяйка. Кредит просит для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Akram T. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 28 years old, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Akram has secondary education. He has been involved in sales of grain products at a market for over 3 years. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing selection

loans.name: M. Judith

texts.fr: A. M. Judith est née le 10 Octobre 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Il y a onze ans que M. Judith vit au quartier Kowègbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une divorcée qui n'a pas d'enfant. M. Judith n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, M. Judith vend depuis onze ans, des tissus par le système de distribution. M. Judith achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. M. Judith a déjà obtenu de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. M. Judith veut renforcer davantage son activité et faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi, M. Judith sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. M. Judith was born on October 10, 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. For eleven years, she has been living in the Kowègbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is divorced and has no children. Judith never attended school. To support herself, she has been selling cloth for eleven years through the distribution system. She purchases her goods in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, and in Lomé, the capital of Togo, which is country neighboring Benin. She obtained an ALIDé loan before, which she repaid. She wants to bolster her business further and to cope with the growing number of demands of her customers. This is why she’s requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of cloth

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar was born in 1980. He lives in the Fuzuli region. 3 years ago he started a sheep breeding business. Now Ilgar is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 10 sheep to improve and increase his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам Хасанова проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 56 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети работают в магазине продавцами. Муж работает "таксистом". Сама Майрам более 3 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она торгует национальной женской обувью. Кредит просит для увеличения товароборота.
texts.en:
Mairam H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 56 years old. She is married and has five children. Her children work as sales people in the store. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Mairam herself has been selling on the market for more than three years. She sells traditional women's shoes. She is asking for a loan to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en:
Mary runs a kiosk from which she sells charcoal, and once in a awhile some vegetables if she is able to get a hold of them. This is the first loan she has ever taken from any institution, and she plans to use it to purchase additional stock of charcoal and potatoes to sell from her kiosk. Mary lives in a very low income area and most of her customers live in this area. Her goal is to one day grow her business and increase her profits so that she can develop a more sturdy, secure home to live in. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase charcoal and potatoes to sell from her kiosk

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 27 years old and married. He sells phones, phone accessories, laptops, and rechargeable phone cards. He has been in this business for three years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more items to sell. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Zita Valérie

texts.fr: D. Zita Valérie est née en 1983 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Zita Valérie est mariée à OGOULOLA A. Prudence, un blanchisseur. Zita Valérie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. C'est à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou que Zita Valérie réside avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Zita Valérie a arrêté les études au secondaire. Depuis sept ans, Zita Valérie est dans la restauration. Mais, Zita Valérie vend également des tissus par le système de distribution. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Zita Valérie veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi, Zita Valérie sollicite ce prêt-ci de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zita Valérie D. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Zita Valérie is married to Prudence A. OGOULOLA, a laundry worker. Zita Valérie is the mother of four children, all in school. Zita Valérie, her children and husband live in Gankpodo, a neighborhood of Cotonou. Together the couple provides for the family's expenses.

Zita Valérie left her studies in middle school. For seven years, Zita Valérie has been in the catering business. However, Zita Valérie also sells fabric through the distribution system. During the year-end holidays, Zita Valérie wants to bolster her working capital to better meet the demand of her customers. For this reason, Zita Valérie is requesting a loan from ALIDé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food supply and fabric

loans.name: Emma Akinyi

texts.en:
Emma started a weaving/embroidery business four years ago and has built up her income to 25,000 Kenya Shillings a month from this business. She never took formal classes, but always had an interest in learning how to embroider and weave. Emma sought out a knowledgeable friend and learned the basics from her. Through her own practice and dedication, Emma became an advanced weaver.

Emma now wants to diversify her income by entering the fish distribution market. This is Emma's third loan from KADET, but the first which she will use for a brand new business. Emma lives in an urban area and most of her customers are middle income earners. Emma's dream is to go to college and attend training in interior design. She is hoping that her fish distribution business will provide her with the money that she needs for tuition.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase supplies of fish to sell

loans.name: Tabriz

texts.en: Tabriz was born in 1977. He lives in the Fuzuli region. This young man is married and has one child. He has been in the house repairing business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy necessary supplies and tools to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary supplies and tools to improve his business.

loans.name: Francis Kamau

texts.en:
Francis Kamau K. is 63 years old, and married with 8 children.

Twenty one years ago, Francis purchased a plot of land and over the years he has developed his housing-rental business.

This is his 6th loan from KADET and with it he will buy materials (cement, sand, stones) and labor to expand his rental building.

Francis has recently diversified his income sources by expanding into farming (wheat, maize and beans). His next venture, he hopes, will be the transportation industry

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy materials and labor to expand his rental building.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil B. was born in 1986. He is single and lives in Fuzuli region.

Kamil has been in the auto repair business for 7 years.

Kamil requests a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Benard Njuguna

texts.en:
Benard Njuguna K. is 35 years old and married with 4 children.

Two years ago Benard started purchasing merchandise (cds, DVDs, VHS tapes) and selling it in various towns. He does not have a kiosk or shop, but instead carries and sells the merchandise on foot. Most of his customers live in low income areas.

Previously Benard borrowed money from friends to purchase the merchandise he sells. He is excited to take his first loan out from an institution.

Benard will use this loan to purchase additional CDs, DVDs and VHS tapes. He dreams of having a shop from which he can sell electronics.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase DVDs, VHS tapes, Cds to sell along the roadside.

loans.name: Oyoniyi

texts.en: Oyoniyi is 35 years old and married, and he has 2 children. He produces and sells rice. He has been in this business for 6 years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more supplies for his rice business. He hopes to increase his production in order to meet the demands of his customers. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for the production of rice

loans.name: Edward Abisalom Obongo

texts.en:
Edward opened his retail shop 5 years ago and has since built it up to generate profits of 35000 KES a month.The types of items he sells in his shop include sodas, detergents, maize, rice, tea, and sugar.

He is married to Maureen Akinyi, who lives upcountry with his family. He sends money back home to Maureen and their 1 year old child. Edward moved to Nairobi in order to better support them.

This is Edward's 5th loan from KADET. He will use it to open another retail shop. He has been saving for a while and this loan will supplement his savings and make this new shop a reality.

One day Edward hopes to venture into the real estate business.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To open another shop.

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiku

texts.en:
Lucy Wanjiku M. is 50 years old and has 6 children.

She started selling second-hand clothing three years ago and earns about 15000 KES a month doing so. Lucy lives in a very low income urban settlement and her customers come from this same area. She sells her merchandise from different locations depending on the day, displaying her second-hand sweaters, pants and tops on a burlap sack mat.

One day, Lucy wants to own a large-scale food distribution shop.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Darou Mboumbaye 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous venons solliciter auprès de votre haute bienveillance un renouvellement de notre prêt réf : 79924 que nous avons soldé même avant échéance. La récolte a été bonne et nous avons bien vendu nos produits. Pour ne pas briser l'élan de notre activité qui est le maraichage, nous voudrions avec ce nouveau prêt, agrandir notre stock en semence et préparer la 2e saison de plantation de pépinières en oignon. Nous ne cesserons jamais de remercier Kiva de nous avoir permis de faire notre activité que nous maitrisons bien et qui nous permet de nous écarter de toute pesanteur sociale.
texts.en:
We kindly request a renewal of our loan ref: 79924 which we repaid even before the due date. The harvest was good and our products well sold. In order not to break the enthusiasm of our business in market gardening, we would like to, with this loan, increase our stock of seeds and to prepare the onion nurseries for planting in the second season. We will always thank Kiva having allowed us to do our business that we master well and which enable us to pull away from all weight of tradition.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for market gardening

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en:
Jane has a retail shop in a sturdy structure. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. Five years ago, Jane started selling general food and household items. She now earns 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month. This is Jane's second loan and she will use it to purchase sugar, wheat flour and maize flour to sell in her store. Most of her customers come from the low income urban settlement where she is based. Jane dreams of business progress and of one day being a wholesale supplier of goods to other retail shops.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop: sugar, wheat flour and maize

loans.name: Esther Wanjiru

texts.en:
Esther started selling used clothing 10 years ago and has grown her customer base over the years. She is 33 years old, married and has a ten-year-old son. She earns about 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month from her business. This is Esther's fourth loan and she will use it to purchase additional used shoes to sell to customers. Esther's customers live in a low income urban settlement. One day, Esther hopes to have enough money to purchase a plot of land and build a home.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy secondhand shoes to sell to customers

loans.name: Tanjudean

texts.en:
Tanjudean sells palm oil. He has been in this business for 10 years. He lives in Ogbomoso in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 39 years old and married, and has a child. 

He wants a loan of N150,000 to purchase more palm kernel to produce oil. He hopes to increase his production to meet the demands of his customers. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel for production of oil

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 45-years old and married with three children. He produces and sells palm oil, a business he has been in for ten years. He is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase palm kernels so he can increase his production and sell to more customers. This will improve his income and help him better provide for his family. Sunday says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel for production of oil

loans.name: Adio

texts.en: Adio is 50-years old and married with four children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Adio produces and sells blocks (which are used for building), a business he has been in for 15 years. He loves his business. He is requesting a loan of $1000 so he can purchase more cement and sand to increase production. This will improve his income and help him better provide for his family. Adio says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and sand for production of blocks

loans.name: Muritala

texts.en: Muritala is 35-years old and married with two children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Muritala has been selling medicine for the past ten years. He says, "I like my business, because I love to save lives." He is requesting a loan of $675 so he can purchase more inventory and service more customers. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El Señor Angel  es un cliente nuevo que trabaja como chofer de minibus hace 14 años y su señora Angelica le ayuda como voceadora. ellos tienen 4 hijos, dos niños en edad escolar y dos niñas pequeñas aun. El señor Angel cuenta solo con una deuda aparte de la nuestra y tiene buen historial crediticio.LA familai  es muy unida y se ayudan mutuamente, tanto como pareja como familia ya que recientemente sufrieron la perdida de un familiar y ellos cumplieron con los pagos de las deudas que el tenia
texts.en:
Mr. Angel is a new client who has been working as a minibus driver for 14 years. His wife Angelica helps as an assistant who calls out destinations. They have 4 children, two school-age children and two preschool girls. Mr. Angel has only one other debt apart from the loan he requests through Kiva, and he has a good credit history. His family is very close and they help each other mutually, both as a couple and as an extended family. In fact, recently they suffered the loss of a relative and they fulfilled the payments of the debts that he had.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires and to maintain the minibus, as well as to buy gas for its operation

loans.name: Ericka Carolina

texts.es: La Señora Erika y su hermana Beatriz se dedican a la elaboracion de escabeche (pickles), ellas iniciaron este negocio hace un par de años buscando clientes por  la zona sur  y produciendo el escabeche segun sus pedidos, ahora que el mercado que abarcan a ido creciendo y asi tambien los pedidos, ellas ven necesario producir en mayor cantidad el escabeche y almacenarlo en un lugar fresco para asi dedicarse agilizar las entregas y dedicarse especialmente a repartir el producto . Es por eso que a señora Erika solicito un credito individual en Emprender como cliente nuevo para inversion en activos fijos
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika and her sister Beatriz dedicate themselves to the production of pickles. They started this business a couple of years ago looking for clients in the southern zone and producing pickles according to clients' requests. Now that the market is growing along with the requests, they find it necessary to produce the pickles in greater quantity and to store them in a fresh place so that the delivery and distribution of the product can occur in a more timely manner. It is because of this that Mrs. Erika requests an individual credit from Emprender (a Kiva field partner) as a new client to invest in permanent assets.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand a room of the house in order to use it as a work and storage space for her product

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more motor spare part

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: Bashiru is 32-years old and married with a child. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He sells oil and crack palm cannel, which is a cleaning and sanitizing agent.  He is requesting a loan for $675 so he can purchase more inventory and service more customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm cannel to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora tiene una tienda bastante grande en la cual cuenta con bastantes productos de primera necesidad, tambien vende embutidos, helados,bebidas gaseosas,tambien tiene cabina de llamadas. La señora Maria vive en alquiler con su esposo que es chapista (arreglo de autos)y sus 2 hijos, ya vive mas de 4 años en esa casa.  El credito  invertira en la compra de heladeras para la venta de refrescos ,helados y embutidos.
texts.en:
Maria owns a large store that offers many basic goods. She also sells sausages, ice cream, drinks, and soda. The store has a phone booth as well. For the past 4 years Maria has rented a home with her husband, who is a metal worker (for car bodywork), and their 2 children. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a refrigerator to keep the sodas, ice cream and sausages in.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for business.

loans.name: Paubla Esperanza

texts.es: Paubla Esperanza tiene 64 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Paubla es otras de las mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras que tenemos en nuestro país, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, cuando inicio no tenía los suficientes recursos para salir adelante, pero con el apoyo del financiamiento fue adquiriendo su propio negocio en donde todas las noches en las afueras de su casa vende sus platillos. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pollos, frutas entre otros productos. Su deseo es tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Paubla Esperanza is 64 years old. She prepares and sells food. Paubla is a one of many strong, entrepreneurial women in our country. She has always liked working and improving her life in a humble way. For the past 5 years she has dedicated herself to this business. When she started it, she didn't have enough resources to get ahead, but with some help through financing she acquired her own business where she sells food outside her home every night. She is now requesting a loan for working capital: the purchase of staple grains, chicken, and fruit, among other things. She hopes to one day have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is a tailor, and he also sells tailoring material. He has been in this business for the past twelve years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring material in order to increase his sales and to meet the demand of his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring material

loans.name: Gilberte

texts.fr: D. Gilberte est née le 05 Novembre 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gilberte est mariée à OLAONIKPEKOUN Ibrahim, un soudeur, et est mère d'un enfant. En plus de cet enfant, le couple a en charge un autre enfant. La famille vit depuis 10 ans à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Gilberte vient en aide à Ibrahim dans les charges de la famille. Gilberte a fréquenté jusqu'au secondaire puis elle a appris la coiffure. Gilberte a son atelier de coiffure à Godomey non loin de Cotonou. Gilberte y vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Gilberte achète ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Gilberte a déjà obtenu un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour agrandir son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Gilberte sollicite un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gilberte D. was born on 5 November 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gilberte is married to Ibrahim Olaonikpekoun, a welder, and she has one child. In addition to this child, the couple also has another child in their care. The family has lived for 10 years in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. Both of the children are in school. Gilberte helps Ibrahim in providing for the family. Gilberte attended up to secondary school, and then trained to be a hairstylist. Gilberte has a hair salon in Godomey, not far from Cotonou. Gilberte sells hair extensions and cosmetics at her salon. Gilberte buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin. Gilberte has already obtained one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To enlarge her business and better satisfy her clientele, Gilberte is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five cartons of cosmetic products and eight dozen boxes of hair extensions

loans.name: Irma Ruth

texts.es: La señora se dedica a la venta D. comida  y bebidas, que ya lleva mas D. ocho años D. experiencia en su negocio, venD. comida D. toda variedad y sabor, que ya es conocida por la exquisites D. sus platos. La señora vive en casa D. sus suegros con su esposo y sus hijos el cual le ayudan a vender comida. el destino del credito es para poder comprar mas sillas y mesas para su puesto.
texts.en:
Irma Ruth has been selling food and beverages for more than eight years. She is known for offering a variety of exquisite and flavorful dishes. She lives in the home of her in-laws with her husband and children, who help with her business. Irma is requesting a loan to buy more tables and chairs for her diner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has been working as a farmer since 2003 and has 15 years of experience in this field. He is a 47-year-old married man and has ten children. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional agricultural equipment in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural equipment

loans.name: Kasser

texts.en: Kasser has been working hard as a farmer since 1990 to earn income and provide better living conditions for his family. He is a 49-year-old married man and the father of seven children. Today, Kasser is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy agriculturA. equipment to further his work and continue to earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural equipment

loans.name: Juana Aurora

texts.es: Juana Aurora tiene 47 años, no pudo obtener la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios, pero sabe leer y escribir. Ella tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo han salido adelante. El negocio al que ella se dedica es una pulpería. Inicio hace más de 4 años, por lo que el salario que ella ganaba no era lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos diarios en su hogar y con sus hijos y fue así que ella lucho por salir adelante con esta actividad. El sueño de Juana es lograr ampliar su negocio cada día hasta convertirse en una mini distribuidora. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo e invertirlo en golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Juana Aurora is 47 years old. She did not have the opportunity to finish her studies, but knows how to read and write. She has 4 children in her care and has made a great effort to get ahead. The business that she runs is a neighborhood store, which she started more than 4 years ago. The salary she earned was not sufficient to cover the daily household expenses or support the children so she was struggling to get ahead with this business. Juana’s dream is to expand the business and become a mini-distributor. The loan that she is asking for is for working capital to invest in sweets, bread, natural juices, and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: In 2005, Walid decided to work as a plumber, installing toilets, faucets etc. as his own business. He is a 31-year-old single man. Having good experience in this field, Walid is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise and more tools to expand and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and more tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cement and building material to sell

loans.name: Nevaditas Group

texts.es:
Verónica B., tesorera del grupo Nevaditas que pertenece al Centro Focal Alto Lima, esta con el grupo aproximadamente 1 año,  ella tiene 27 años y hace poco falleció su esposo y se quedo al cuidado de sus dos hijos, para sustentar a su familia vende cosméticos todos los días en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de Desaguadero  ya que adquiere  con menos precio 
Al igual que Verónica, las demás integrantes del grupo también tiene sus propios negocios como la venta  de ropa, papa, artefactos, material escolar, fruta, otras de dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir como chamarras y tejido de ropa con lana de alpaca.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima e insumos y seguir trabajando en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Verónica B., treasurer of the Nevaditas group of the Alto Lima Center, has been with the group for about one year and is 27 years old. Recently, her husband passed away and she is now left to care alone for her two children. To sustain her family, she sells cosmetics every day in the city of El Alto and needs this loan to purchase merchandise from Desaguadero because she can acquire it there at a lower price. Like Verónica, the other members of the group also have their own businesses such as selling clothing, potatoes, artifacts, school materials, and fruit. Others make clothing items like jackets, and knit clothing with Alpaca wool. They all need the loan to purchase commodities and raw materials, and continue working on their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of commodities and raw materials
